reviewText:
Is this game worth?Is it as good as the previous black ops games?Is it pay to win?

At first i have to tell you that i have no experience on campaign and zombies since i mostly play online.
You may think that call of duty series are ruined,i think that developers created a game that its as good as the previous black ops series.If you are not sure if the game is for your taste watch youtube videos,if you buy it from steam and you realize that you are not going to play you can refund it.

Online.
It took me 5h to underestand how to play but after i underestood the game became impressive.
The weapons are balanced the skins that you unlock(of curse not all of them)are good.After every game you get coins that you can spend unboxing random staff from suply drops which is good since its not that hard to collect them(5games for the first,15 for the second).

Is the game pay to win?Look,of curse you can pay to receive coins and unlock more suply drops than others,but that doesnt make you better than others you may just have better skins figures and melee weapons(combat knife deals same damage with them).

I wanna buy the game but i dont cause of the negative reviews?!

My opinion is to try the game,its a triple a video game that sells million of copies,Certainly there are players that are not happy with the game they dont like something and they create a negative review,Most of people argue for disconnects,i have a normal internet subscription and i dont have problem with disconnects(except when activision update the game and every one has higher ping,its naturaly.

I strongly recommend the game especially on sale since you can buy everything with 60-80$(full game,season pass)

reviewText:
Pretty damn good game. with plenty of content and just enough to really persuade you to get the digital deluxe. Even if its for zombies- its THAT good. Story is alright and you can play any mission you want for as long as you want- tons of replay ability. Multiplayer content is fantastic, kinda like black ops 2.
However that is only in the case of the console versions. Here pfftt. From what i would say a solid 7/8 out of 10 is merely a disgusting 4 out of 10 on the pc.
Yet again, the pc community is forgotten and will always be * sigh*
People complained about Advanced warefare, but at least the graphics would work and the game would actually launch . *Sigh*
It really bothers me, someone who was loyal to the series ever since modern warfare, has to see this from their now, not so favourite game developer.
You let me down Treyarch and Activision. You let all of us down.

Edit: I highly agree to buy this if your a hardcore fan but i do suggest to all ingeneral to see if Treyarch keeps their promise and actually allows community modding. Then i highly suggest buying it, because if it will be anything like WAW then you can get more than 200 hours of fun.
The new micro transaction thing seems acceptable but if it escalates like AW then don't bother. Time will tell :P
Edit: They said that match making with be SBMM ( skill based) which was part of AW. I dont have mind playing with others of the same level and skill but this does mean that THAT will be the priority instead of general connections. So if find yourself lagging more its probably because you're playing with/against peoples across the world :P

reviewText:
TL;DR: WAIT FOR PERFORMANCE UPDATES OR BUY CONSOLE VERSION.

Low FPS , poor optimization. Do not buy if you are looking for a stable game.

Stuff like if you alt+tab you get put into windowed mode everysingle time.
You have to see the opening 'cinematic' every time you start the game and there is no getting around it.

Overall ported horrible for PC. Hopefully updates are coming.

Worst COD launch ever.

Update 18 november:
Performance updates and bug fixes 14 november.
Still doing a terrible job with the PC port and only small things are fixed. Mostly compatibility with 'bad' computers.

Also when we are at it we can add some other problems to the list:
- 'You have lost connection to the host.' In a singleplayer offline game.
- FPS is still dropping from 100 to below 30.
- Still can't alt tab without going into windowed mode and risk getting the game capped at 30 FPS. [FIXED]
- Servers are still lagging just as much as they did the first week.

All love to the COD games. But if you are going to buy this. For the love of god, spend your cash on a console version.

reviewText:
Here's my opinion:
Zombies is awesome! Shadows of evil is pretty complicated and has a big learning curve, but I am a hardcore zombies fan so i don't mind, but just beware of that.
Multiplayer is pretty good, it plays a lot like black ops 2 multiplayer with a few changes like wall running and specific characters to choose from,
I personally don't like the campaign, it has a really weird story and I usually prefer a more realistic view to campaign.
Black ops 3 is more complicated than previous COD'S, but it has a lot of new mechanics added in like customizable guns in zombies, dark matter camo, and the paintshop that give you something to work towards. I would personally reccomend this game to anyone who has like previous black ops games but maybe wanted a new spin on them.   7/10
voteText: 12 of 17 people (71%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game still has a long ways to go with regards to optimisation, as an i5 user i'll get 100% cpu usage with sometimes barely 40% gpu usage. I've set a cap of 59 fps because theres weird input lag if your fps is above or even below the refresh rate of your monitor.

I've been able to mostly keep the cap of 59 fps with a mix if high to medium settings, with some weird drops because of the rediculous cpu usage. The core gameplay content is enormous though and with modding support being added sometime in 2016, this game will have an infinite amount of content for countless hours of [zombies] gameplay. If you have a decent pc, I would recommend getting this now.

I've had 1 crash so far and 1 disconnect, that was due to treyarch and my other disconnect is due to my internet. If you have a mid range pc or mid to low with a 750 ti for example, I would say to wait a month or two until treyarch can push out a major performance patch.

It's a shame this game is plagued by performance issues as the core content is really great, I mean they made a whole zombies campaign that fans have been asking for since its inception with world at war. Theres gobblegums which add a nice dimension to zombies and weapon kits which is really cool.

I haven't played too much of campaign, but I'd hazard a guess that its your generic cod campaign with turret segments.

Multiplayer is fun, very quick.

TL;DR Content is there, performance wise its lacking. Only get it now if you have a beefy pc, otherwise refund and wait for patches to fix performance issues.

reviewText: Yet again another poorly optimized port that is becoming a far too common issue with PC games. The game is a mess, with slow rendering textures, stutters and massive FPS drops. My rig destroys PS4 and Xbox one, but this game on PC is quite clearly a rushed job. This is the same issue that Batman Arkham Knight had, not sure if the company outsourced the game to others, or they just didn’t put the time into the PC version as they did the consoles. Either way it's a disgrace and should be taken down until they fix it, if that’s even possible.\n\nIn future if a company can’t be bothered to properly develop a game for PC, then just don’t bother. We don’t want your crappy ports and shoddy practises. People pay hard earned money for these products and you have the audacity to sell this game in its current state? It's borderline criminal and unacceptable. Don’t buy this game or get a refund on Steam quick. Also make sure to leave your review regarding your experience to as many review sites as possible, the PC community should not stand for this any more.

reviewText: Being a huge COD Single player fan I dove head-first into this one hoping for some good entertainment on the weekend.\nNot meant to happen... First of all, the game randomly slows down to an unbearable stutter for no apparent reason just to be working completely fine in the same scenery, same settings after restart or death or just because f**k you
date: that's why".\nThe game feels glitchy with bits of game-engine based scenes flashing occasionally inbetween cutscenes or sometimes for no apparent reasons. AI is probably the worst I've seen in an FPS game in a long stretch. Computer opponents just stand still most of the cases. Friendlies sometimes stop and stare at walls... Textures look incredibly pixelated (or sometimes are just missing!) on any setting below "Extra" and explosions are sets of flat animated sprites that sometimes look funny when occuring on small surfaces where it just looks like taken straight from Doom 1 :). Sometimes you do see flickering
recommended: stretched polygons instead of textures or sprites. Story feels incredibly fragmented with vaguely associated episodes. The worst bit so far is the voice-over tho. Sounds absolutely fake and lacklustre
hoursPlayed: and is quite obiously recorded in fragments with VO actors not seeing the actual game during a session. Many times I was under an impression that the VO doesn't really match what I'm seeing on screen. Absolutely horrid.\n\nAs a big and long-time fan I have to admit that it's probably the worst Call of Duty game I've played so far. What makes things even worse is the fact that in the main menu there's a button that blatantly says "Coming Soon" being almost a spit in the face from the Dev saying "Yes we didn't finish the game for which you've paid the full price. Whaddya gonna do about it?"."

reviewText:
The game runs like crap.  I have a GTX 970 and a 4770k, so the issues aren't because I have a bad computer.

I get constant stuttering and mouse delay, among other issues.  Every gun takes up half the screen, no matter the fov.  There is a blue screen after the end of every match, which I'm sure will be fixed soon.

I have tried every setting, aside from resolution, which shouldn't have to be adjusted since I play at 1080p.  As of now, do not buy this game.  I will update the review as things get fixed, if I remember...

If they think the game is finished enough to release, then it's finished enough to review, no matter the state of the game.  Please hold off on throwing your money at this game.  Just because it's the same developer as some of the best CoDs in history, doesn't mean the quality of the game is the same.

Oh, one last thing.  They brought back supply drops.

Pros:
✔Campaign is awesome. It is dark, atmospheric and keeping you interested the whole time
✔Visuals are good. Well, engine is old, but the game is still looking ok
✔Customization everywhere. From multiplayer to even single player
✔Large and non-linear SP levels
✔Shadows of Evil and Giant maps are looking and playing great
✔Multiplayer is good. It's same but this is what makes it good

Cons:
✘Scenario is weak. Characters are not memorable at all
✘Voice-acting is average. Nothing special comparing to Black Ops 2
✘Only 1 zombie map without Deluxe Edition
✘Campaign is not built for coop mode
✘Optimization was very poor. Seems fixed for me now, but still it is a shame what after 3 years 3arc cant simply optimize the game on this old engine
✘Boring MP maps. They are not adapted to new movement mechanic
✘Some balance problems in MP
✘Large SP levels are empty, there is nothing to explore

Since I am a COD fanboy this game worth 60$ for me. But I feel kinda dissapointed. I thought what after 3 years of development 3arc will made a game that would be a worthy succesor of Black Ops 2. But actually this is a step backwards after 3arc previous game. But still it is a lot fun. I recommend it.

reviewText:
If you are debating to get Blackops 3 then refer to this checklist!

1. Do you enjoy playing a game without absolutely no recoil?

2. Do you enjoy playing a game where you can run for days?

3. Do you enjoy playing a game where you shooting/spraying someone then you are suddenly killed in one shot?

4. Do you enjoy playing a game where people only like to run around with overpowered shotguns where recoil doesn't exist?

5. Do you enjoy playing a game where firerate of weapons are completely insane?

6. Do you enjoy playing a game where you can aim down the sights while sprinting?

7. Do you enjoy playing a game where you can sprint and shoot without recoil involved?

8. Do you enjoy playing a game where where assault rifles are completely useless against SMGs?

9. Do you enjoy playing a game where there is a class where a knife beats a person with a gun?

10. Do you enjoy playing a game where there is no level limits in a queue/lobby and then high level dominate the entire game?

11. Do you enjoy playing a game where you are able to remove items from your class to just make your primary overpowered as possible including as many perks as you can stack?

If any of these apply to you and don't like it, then I highly recommend not to get the game!

reviewText:
Over my time of playing Black Ops lll, I am glad to say I recommend it. The Multiplayer is a blast. The specialists are very cool. A couple of my favorite are the REAPER and Purifier. With Bo3 doing 2XP about every other week, it can be very easy to level up and catch up in rank with the other Black Ops 3 Veterans.  With the first DLC coming out in just a few short weeks, I can’t express how much fun I will have on the new maps they’re bringing in this DLC and the other DLC yet to come!


However with Multiplayer being great, I have few complaints about the campaign.  I feel like it has a few bugs that can be annoying. Things like you can’t run alongside a wall or mission progress not saving. All of the Black Ops stories never made as much sense as the Modern Warfare series did. At least for me. I still like the Black Ops stories, but I feel like they don’t fully explain things 100%.  Overall, the campaign had many cool things about it.

For anyone who has had worries about their system not working, it ran fine on my Lenovo Y40-70 laptop. Specs are on my profile. But the graphics in this game didn’t look that great on low-medium compared to previous CoD games.  That is the only other complaint I have.

Despite the few campaign issues I had, I still highly recommend this. It’s a CoD game, if you’re a true fan, you’ll love it!

reviewText:
This game has become the standard in Call Of Duty shooters these days. Run on walls like spiderman, and shoot people with guns that can see through walls. If you were planning on buying this game because you were expecting it to be different, look somewhere else.

GAMEPLAY: This is a farcry from the golden days of MW and the gameplay has changed dramatically since then. Firefights are tougher yet quicker and you are rewarded for bouncing around like a monkey and avoiding shots more then you are rewarded for using pure gun skill. While this is the fastest CoD iv'e ever played gameplay wise, the game couldn't feel any more unbalanced if Tryarch even tried. Semi-Auto Snipers are heavily used and incredibly devistating. Especially considring how easy it is to hit a target. If you loved MW2/MW3 sniping, You won't find anything like it here. Shotguns also have always been powerful in previous titles, but never like this. Shotguns not only deal high damage when hit directly, the range at which you can kill people from has at least doubled since Bo2 making cheap kills easy and incouraging hip fire gameplay over precision.

GRAPHICS: Black Ops 3 is Activision's best attempt yet at bringing the franchise forward graphically and it really shows. Weapon skins pop, running the game on the highest quality is pure eye candy, which is saying something considering CoD has always been considered as a very dated looking series. These stunning graphics were the real reason I purchased Bo3. Sound quality was also surprisingly good. Not battlefield good, but still better then I was expecting in comparison to previous titles in the series.

So ok, it's a great looking game. What could go wrong right? Apparently everything. Over the years Activision has continued to slowly neglect more and more on PC gamers, and their most recently entry into the series shows. Lag spikes when walking down a path, 40fps frame drops when you aim at an enemy, hard crashes, the list goes on. This is the most poorly optimised Call Of Duty that iv'e ever played on PC. While I do run a farely good set up on my home PC (i7 4770K, R9 290 4GB) changing graphics setting from highest to low only gained me an Additional 30fps yet did nothing to lessen the continuas lag spikes and frame drops I was experiencing in-game. Quite unfortunate that a game that looks this good barely even runs well on higher end PC's.


VERDICT: If you love CoD and you've played every one of Activisions games in recent years then your probably going to buy this title regardless of what I have to say in this short review. But if you came here looking for a good reason to get back into the series or you haven't played one of their games recently. I honestly can't give you a good enough reason to throw $60 at it. It's just not worth the upgrade from AW or Bo2.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Unfortunately I was one of the people who got this on launch day...
That was a big mistake. This game has so many issues and I'm not just talking about the PC version neither. I also own this game on Console (Next and old gen) Only to still be disappointed with issues that should have really put into consideration.
Things like servers repeated and constantly disconnecting random texture glitches terrible Frame rate on console and even Pc at certain points.
I'm not writing this because I hate the franchise or think the series was better without jump packs. I'm writing this because of the broken system the game is in now. Things like the supply drop system was fine at first because of the fact it was a free Slot machine" like way of getting new skins. But now it's been destroyed because of the fact they added new weapons that are slightly more powerful than the default weapons you can unlock while you level up in multiplayer. (I'm looking at you Shadow Claw and the MX-Garand)

Now I'm not going to lie to you I got this game as a gift from a friend. But I payed for the other two versions. But I feel slightly bad for him consider he payed Full price for the game.

Also the PC version of the game is running issues? ( This is the reason I'm writing the review) Now my PC could run this game perfectly. But after my hard drive Crashed and I got a new one and upgraded the windows on it it has completely stopped running.

Now finally these are some small issues with the game
date:
Should this really have been called black ops 3? I mean it has nothing to do with the other two games.

My final opinion of the game.

The game isn't as bad as people say it is. But I wouldn't recommend this as your first Call of Duty game. Try out Either the Modern Warefare Series or maybe the original black ops games.
"

reviewText:
INITIAL REVIEW
--------------------------------------------------------------
This game is aids. Quite literally once played it goes deep into your computer and sucks it dry. After starting this steaming pile of horse turd, my pc memory usage goes up to 95%. For flip sake 95% of 20gb ram being used for a game?!?! Worst part is, the game even after closure causes the system to go ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ and start having a seizure.

MY SPECS:
Intel Core i7 4790k OC'd to 4.6ghz
Nvidia Geforce gtx 980 ti clocked to about 1178mhz
20gb of ddr3 1333mhz ram

Now, the settings I play this cancer on:
Resolution 800x600
Resolution scale 50%
Everything else, lowest possible settings

Can you believe even on these settings I do not get a solid 60, in shootouts (nearly always as to the nature of the game) my fps drops under 10fps!!! If anyone could please tell me how to get this SOB of a game working then I'd be really happy, I have yet to play a port worse than this, and oh yes I've played Unity, I can at least get 40-60 on highest settings there. Now bear in mind, this isn't a review on how good the game is itself, it's a review on the ♥♥♥♥ING DISGUSTING PERFORMANCE. Avoid if you have specs similar to mine because I've heard that other people can run it perfectly on lower specs, I assume it may be a specific problem to higher end computers???

10/10 will infect my pc with aids again.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update as of 18/11/15:
Now that finally all the performance problems have been fixed (constant 60fps on a DSR) I can finally play the god damn game to review it, I will eventually get round to it.

reviewText:
Played the game for over 100 hours, and this is the conclusion I have come too. The game goes like this all the time:

-Start the game

-Go into multiplayer

-Start searching for a match

-Game is about to start

-Loading

-Start

-Chooses a gun

-Runs into a enemy

-Gets shotgunned

-Goes on like nothing happended

-Finds a enemy

-Another enemy who is camping in a corner hardscoopes me

-Slight annoyed but doesn't mind

-Finally gets a kill

-Going on with a good scorestreak

-Gets called hacker and words

-Ignore the cry babies

-100 points away from RAPS

-Enemy is camping in a corner

-Catches me off guard and shotgunned me

-About to break my monitor

-Gives one last try

-Going with a good score streak again

-Gets hardscoped by a noob

-RAGE QUITS!!

This is how the game goes for me at least, there is other bad things too about this, like WTF is the stupid black market for, getting new goodies. NO! Its a rip off to mine some money from the players and even if you get a gun or sometihing, you would must likely have used 100 dollars, for an average SMG or stupid meele knife.
Then there are people out there who only play one map and spam the heck out of it, like Nuketown for example. A lot of campers too and to many NOOBgun users.

I have like 100 hours on this game. and that is mainly because I did enjoy at one point and I still do, if I am lucky and get into good match, with good player I can most likely play for about 3-4 rounds and then it gets boring. Even the zombies isn't that good or fun to play, Black ops 1 for me persoanlly had the best zombies after Black Ops 2. so honestly guys if you want a good Call of Duty game, buy Black Ops 2, because this is not a game worth your time and its certainly not worth the full price either, so if you are going to buy it, do it when there are sales.
Overall score:

If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumb up! :)

Overall score:  4/10

reviewText:
Contrary to popular reviews, Black Ops III is pretty darn fun.

Like I wrote in my Beta review, COD is COD like Madden is Madden. Are there connection issues and optimization headaches? Yeah. Just like every other damn COD title. While there are problems with the game (like any other game, lol) over half of the reviews on this game are exaggerated or reviewed by teens trying to play BO3 on a machine that's only fit to handle games like tetris or minesweeper.

The massive COD hate train will bash the game and at the same time give BO3 a $550 million release paycheck. If they were smart and really hated the game, they wouldn't give COD a moment of their time. And if COD was as bad as the hate train claims, no one would be buying their ♥♥♥♥.

Anyways, the game is fun. It's just like other COD games just with a little extra ♥♥♥♥ added. Surprised? But hey, if COD is something you've enjoyed over the many years, you'll like BO3.

Some neat stuff that was added:

- Many different characters (Specialists) to choose from. Each one has 2 special abilities you can unlock. You can only use one ability in a game. This is probably the biggest addition because there's a lot of variety of abilities.

- TONS of new calling cards. This may seem irrelevant but there are an insane amount of calling cards with a lot of different art styles. Including some pretty ballin animated ones.

- Cases. You earn Cryptokeys" (1-2 from my experience) per match (playing a full match is better rather than playing half a match). For 10 keys you can open a common case
date: for 30 keys you can open a rare case. Rare cases guarantee a rare item in them. Each case will contain 3 items. There's common
hoursPlayed: epic
voteText: legendary items. Everything from camos
helpfulPercent: taunts
votesHelpful: decals
votesTotal: gear
votesFunny: calling cards
commentsCount:
etc.


I could go on but I'm tired of typing. It's a fun game.
"

reviewText:
One month and 172 hours it is finally time, time to give a review of the Black Ops III multiplayer game I have been so engorged in to this moment. Why multiplayer only you might ask? Because the game has been so enjoyable that the Campaign to which I am usually fully immersed in has been an afterthought.

Black Ops III is fun plain and simple! As much as I want to hate on the franchise from its disappointing releases I just can't dislike this game in full. The core gameplay is done well and often great which is something I couldn’t say for most triple A titles released in the past few years to which I have played.

Where to start? This is the hard part as there's so many things I just want to say are awesome from the weapons to the maps and game modes so let's just go over that.

The weapons in Black Ops III are all quite simplistic to use in basic gameplay while each presenting a slightly different advantage in different gun fight situations and play styles. Each SMG can be used quite similar in combat but at the same time offer a different feeling to the user the more you figure out its slight strengths or weaknesses as long with your own. This feeling of equality yet individuality extends to the Assault Rifles, Shotguns, Light Machine Guns and Snipers a like. The variety in attachments is also one to be mentioned in that each weapon can be built differently for different strengths and play styles and at the same time each weapon can also follow a similar principle rule and in the end all be competitive in their own right. When you exclude the right time right place situations where each weapons dominate I truly believe everything can be enjoyed and used to conquer the server and or objective. As a Counter-Strike player I can say that this is fun and quite nice that I can change it up depending on how I feel rather than using the same few weapons kill after kill and death after death.

The Maps in Black Ops III present everything I looking for in a casual shooter and much more. The maps are well balanced and unique mostly in their own right, not just in scenery but also in design and gameplay. Do you enjoy Sniping mid? Taking long range gun battles? Sitting around mid map with the option to rotate forward or back? Flanking left or right to any part of the map or even sneaking through middle? Close quarter combat with plenty of objects and divisions to play technical and fast? This game has it all and I really cannot put in words the detail of the variety of situations and positions this game can put you in as you read my mess above. The game is always offering multiple paths to each position generally giving a lot of different places to play from making each game flexible to your desires.

The Game Modes are all mostly different and fun like the weapons and maps all providing quite different options for  the player to have more and different experiences. Hardpoint and Domination in concept may be comparable for the average gamer but in no way do they play the same in any map in the pool, the same for Uplink and Capture the Flag being similar but still offering different gameplay experience. There is just so much gameplay in the game modes on offer! It is rare a game can offer this many game modes! With the good comes the bad and that is the popularity of certain game modes. I can pretty much guarantee you will be able to play Team Deathmatch, Domination and Chaos Moshpit at any time you desire but that is about Is about it. The other game modes are mostly anywhere from 0-2% of the players playing and often impossible to get a decent game unless you manage to join an ongoing game where someone has just quit from. Don't get me wrong you may be able to find a game and play a session here or there but you won’t be able to do this anytime you get the itch which is a problem that can most only be put on the players.

Ok so this is starting to get long too long so I will just brush over everything else as fast as I can since I think the above is the most important of this game.

Graphics are good and there is not huge differences in most settings from low to extra with the exception of a few. The game is of the 2015 trend which is starting to require more than 8gb of Ram and 2gb of Vram but still working. With a 4770k Overclocked to 4.2ghz paired with a Asus Strix OC 970 and 16gb of Ram I am still only getting 120-180 fps on all settings low/off with AA on the minimum. This is a mixed feeling for 144hz gamers with upper mid range PCs getting the feeling of barely getting by. Sound is done well, as a CS and Quake player I just wish they were a bit louder but it's clear decision of game design promoting more action and less standing around listening so I'm ok with it.

There is a few things that prevent this game from being better on PC and I would like to quickly go over them. Dedicated servers were promised and what we got was a entirely different definition to what we thought they were, in other words they are just the same peer to peer system used in less demanding games. Why is a huge mystery since the franchise makes more money then the owners or employees could possibly count but I suspect this has something more to do with it functioning better on console and being a console port. Touching on the console subject the game is lacks a PC touch you usually get in the menus and ui compared to most other games on PC.

I could type about the Arena Mode or lack of for twice as long but I will just say most players I have seen who have played the previous half a dozen titles don't even know or care what it is. I put this down to the publisher and developer not clearly presenting the mode as what it is and that is Competitive, yes competitive game mode which no one even knows about. Dam that's easily half of the reason CSGO went from 3 million players to over 9 million in the past 12 months alone.

Theres more things to which are not game breaking but could be game changing if done better but we will leave them.

Overall from what I have seen in all the profiles of player to which dozens were looked at, most have put already more time in Black Ops III then the majority of their other Call of Duty games they own combined. This cannot be a coincidence but affirming that this could be one of the best Call of Duty games to date.

I give this game a near 8/10 as a game and a 9/10 for a Call of Duty game.

There is so much I wanted to go over but cannot without writing a essay, this review is from experience and thought about the game in every way possible while enjoying my play time. I am uninterested in the generic youtube reviews posted a couple of days after release of the same vague opinions.

I can easily see why this is the absolute best choice of FPS game on console to date, but sadly it falls outside of the top 3 for PC and probably top 5.

Thank you!

reviewText:
I honestly had a ton of fun with this game.  But I was Vac (Valve anti-cheat)- banned from it.  From what I understand, the VAC software constantly checks for any background programs you are running that are for cheating/hacking the game.  While it is a mostly fool-proof system, the latest thing I had downloaded was rainmeter -_-.  On top of wrongfully banning me (and conveniently ignoring the hackers that were present almost every game), all steam support would do when I support ticket was send me a bot message that all vac bans were final and blah blah blah.  While doing some digging I saw there may be an appeal process if you contact the developer, (in this case it was activision/treyarch).  Even worse, you can't even try to send a support ticket or talk to a real person.  All they have are forums that they MIGHT look at.
This is less of  a bad review on the game itself, and more of a bad review on Valve and Activision.
After years of not playing Call of Duty, they finally release a game that I legitimately enjoy, then after only a month, immediately snatch it from me with not even a reason why I was banned (because im pretty sure it wasnt even rainmeter).
But yeah, pros: good story-ish, fun to play multiplayer, fun zombies (not as good as first black ops tho
Cons: hackers go unpunished (except for me and my hacking" self apparently)
date: and thats basically it\nhackers/aimboters can really ruin the multiplayer at times."

reviewText:
Graphics seem to take us back a few years in video game history. The story mode, like some other COD games, is bad. I really don't know why developers spend time and money on such bad story modes in COD games at this point. The game mechanics are okay. Some things like boost jumping feel like shoddy attempts at replicating things from Advanced Warfare (the story itself is another example).

My overall impression is that this is a poorly designed product relative to what can be expected in big title PC games with a 2015 release date. I can't see myself buying another COD game after this, and don't particularly enjoy having this one. I can't invest that much time in it (partly for the above reasons), so I usually have basic weapons and attachments and just go on for 30mins or until I am tired of being frag-bait for 75% of players who get all the good guns/attachments because they play more. Would be nice to see winning and losing depend more on skill, and if there absolutely has to be more systems to keep people sinking in more hours, then it would be nice to see that payoff more in cosmetic upgrades instead (but this criticism applies to all or most COD games).

If you are going to put in lots of hours, then like a hacker with access to all kinds of souped up stuff you can dominate most of the people that don't have that stuff (and some people really like to do that so... perhaps this is the secret to COD's success).

reviewText:
The ONLY reason I purchased this was for the Zombies expansion. I played a lot of Call of Duty Black Ops 2 multiplayer, however, when participating in the COD Black Ops 3 Beta, I was not impressed at all by the direction they took. Ever since my purchase of Black Ops 3, I think I've played a total of 1-2 hours of actual multiplayer and the rest has been strictly Zombies.

From what I played of regular Multiplayer, it was ok. I'm not a HUGE fan of futuristic games. The wall jumping is cool, and so is the new sliding animations. I seem to pick up around 70 frames in-game with my R9 390X; sometimes dipping below 40 (depending on what is going on -- while running 1080p). I like the idea of how items are unlocked, but I feel as if they are way over-doing the micro-transactions.

Zombies; hands-down is great. BUT for only one reason; DLC 1 - The Awakening and the Der Eisendrache map (hopefully DLC 2 leaves me in shock and awe). For maybe around 2-3 weeks; Shadows of Evil had a bug that would randomly kick the party out of the game for no particular reason with the error: Exceeded '250' items for type 'Triggerstring'" - no matter where you were in the game. It took them quite a bit of time to actually patch this (as of patch 1.10) and I can recall the bug existing for at least three (3) weeks. This is completely unacceptable considering I am positive the error was reported to the developers
date: and the fact of it forced players of the Zombie expansion to go get the DLC in order to be able to play zombies at all.\n\nThe other biggest complaint I have is that Zombies releases with only ONE map for the $60.00 we pay as a customer
recommended: and then we get 1 extra map for each DLC ($15.00 per map - or by purchasing the season pass and saving $10.00 as a discount). This is quite an expensive deal considering most of the people I've read comments from and played with; only buy Black Ops JUST for zombies. I'm sure it isn't hard to put at least two (2) maps into the release of zombies so that players at lease have a selection. Because with that error going on prior to the patch
hoursPlayed: players without the DLC / Season pass had nothing to play
voteText: and that's not right considering they did purchase the game. As a fellow developer; that bug should of only existed for 2-3 days MAX if it was a difficult one to address
helpfulPercent: not weeks and weeks. It almost feels like the company did that on purpose in order to get more sales on their DLC. That's just speculation and I really hope it isn't the case
votesHelpful: but it looks rather fishy from a developer's stand-point.\n\nI would make the recommendation to the company -- release multiplayer and the Zombies expansion on their own separate purchases instead of this unholy amount of cash you have to take out of your pocket to pay for stuff you won't even use. I'm all for paying the price for a great game

column17: because your regular multiplayer sales would drop quite a bit.\n\nOverall

reviewText:
The best Call of Duty since World At War. Base Call of Duty mechanics with a more Arena Shooter style feel - The movement is easily compareable to a mixture of Unreal Tournament 4's Alpha (Q1 2016 release) (with a bit of UT3-isms) with a bit longer wall running that UT4; in the vein of Titanfall but not as overly long.
- SP - C+/B- (CO-OP B+ due to how well thought out the Co-oP really was!) -
- Zombies - A- - World at War still has the best Zombie Mode, and while I only have the retail map, I can say they did it proper compared to the recent installments; although I hope they bring the WaW and Initial Blops 1 Zombie Maps in DLC
- MP - Playing Casually for Fun - A+  - dead on 97 CoD meets Unreal/Quake? Great Job Treyarch!
- MP - Playing with your eSports Team as a group - A+ - Everything you want in coordination and tactics from eSports at the break neck speed of titles like UT/Quake that while UT4 will also heavily focus on CTF in eSports, and DOOM will have Clan Arena a serious eSports mode... Duels are what these titles are known for; to nail down that speed and movement in endless team based modes deserves the score!
- MP - Playing Competitive Leagues or Pugs on PC platform = B- due to PS4 being lead eSports platform and difficulty finding good competition
- MP - Net Code - A- - Very Solid; only complaint is how the slight aim assisting that occurs seems to alter hit boxes in patches but it is improving
- MP GAME MODE VARIETY = A+ 100/100  -  BUT  -  Due to the fact nobody plays the amazing Demolition, CTF, Uplink, ... hell any mode that isnt TDM, DOM, and you can /find HardPoint / Kill Confirmed / Matches but.... sometimes you seriously can NOT outside the moshpit playlist. Thus PC Modes played Earns a rough C instead of the perfect A+ 100/100
- Player Base - Not as toxic as Counter-Strike which I cannot believe I am saying! Nowhere as helpful as Rainbow Six Siege. B+

Overall A-
voteText: 11 of 17 people (65%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game brought back many great memories I have of black ops 2, both multiplayer and zombies. Although it has its hiccups with performance and optimisation due to being neglected on PC (console being Activision's and Treyarch's main audience.)

The multiplayer is fluent and very black ops 2 esque, except it has the extra 'futuristic' features such as the jump-pack and wall-running (which I think is a great feature.) The maps have gone with the '3 path' approach (left side, right side and the middle) which is good when it comes to fighting in chokepoints, granting players to flank with ease. Overall, the weapon system is quite balanced and feels like Black Ops II, with the classic CoD tropes like smg run 'n' gun, bolt action snipers = best sniper etc.

The zombies gamemode is by far my favourite. I remember playing transit and all of the other blops 2 zombie maps and they were really fun. The stock map 'Shadows of Evil' follows a similar storyline to the Black Ops II map 'Mob of the Dead.' Where the four playable characters have all committed a sin which needs to be settled with by an external force. The map layout might seem quite daunting at first but after playing it multiple times you'll get the hang of it. The classic perk machines are back and the new gobblegum feature adds a little extra to the mode also, with the ability to get extra perks like keeping your guns after downing, or the more rare gobblegums like the wall buy auto pack-a-punched (which in my opinion seems really overpowered.)

Overall, zombies and multiplayer are my favourite parts of the game, they are both balanced and well-made in regards to keeping it fresh and fun.

Also, the campaign sucks as always <|:^)

reviewText:
For a first-person shooter, this game is great. The multiplayer servers are not the best, with frequent lag spikes and losing connection. DLC Content is great, with new maps and weapons being introduced on a regular basis, which is great to see. Played this game for nearly 200 hours now, and have enjoyed most of my time playing it. The graphics are of a good quality, and the maps are fun to play on. Have played a little Campaign, and love it. The detail in it is great, but I wish that could be introduced into Multiplayer as well.

The only thing it could do to improve is to make the Multiplayer Servers more 'stable', and maybe focus a little more on the PC Servers, not just PS4 and Xbox platforms.

Overall - 8/10
DLC Content - 9/10

reviewText:
Instantly fills up 5GB of RAM and has an out of memory error for my GPU. I have a 980Ti with 6GB of VRAM, and this game has nowhere near the visual fidelity to warrant this. I can barely play 2 minutes of the campaign without the game crashing my whole PC.

This is, of course, when the game starts up at all, when it doesn't instantly crash itself or my entire PC right after showing the developer logos. And this also is when I can't play the online mode. Which is never. I cannot connect at all online, getting an error like A.B.C.D.... and have had NO response from Activision Support, though I've contacted them incessantly since launch.

You should not purchase this game right now, and I highly caution purchasing it anytime after that. We should not support this kind of release being pushed out the door unfinished, and we should certainly not give them money (when or if it ever gets fixed) for something they should have done at launch.

EDIT: Upgraded to 16GB of RAM and plugged directly into my router (had to move my entire rig downstairs). Online now works fine, but still runs pretty badly (medium settings still stutters often, but certainly playable). Single player somehow now runs worse (even low settings running around 40FPS). Although I'd rate the game better than I did on launch, it's still not worth buying on PC. Even so, it is an alright game. Just exactly what you'd except from a post-Titanfall, post-Advanced Warfare CoD. Though it's still not even as good as Advanced Warfare in my opinion. If you really want this game, get it on console.

reviewText:
And yet another yearly Call of Duty game!

Here's what I think about it:

I have mixed feelings with Black Ops 3. While it doesn't try to reinvent the franchise, you do feel at home with pretty much everything offered to you. Main campaign, zombie mode set in the campaign, an old style zombie mode from the '40s and of course, the main selling point of every CoD games, the MultiPlayer. It is like 4 games in 1!

Whether you are a fan or not of the CoD franchise, you can always expect a working game, USUALLY but it wasn't the case here. While I haven't experienced anything really nasty, I did had a few frame drops and slowdowns at areas in the story mode campaign.

Campaign
From start till midway into, I was quite interested on the story, where it was headed and such but after you reach midway until the end, it simply feels like some messed up Micheal Bay average story that doesn't make much sense! Missions are quite the same, very linear. What I found questionable was the lack of references of previous Black Ops games. BO3 didn't seem to be a sequel" per sé and if you are new into this franchise
date:
you'll simply feel as lost as I was in the story! The cyber powers do add possible replayability of missions and try other powers!

Zombie Mode (campaign)
This plays out the same missions of the campaign
recommended: set in different orders and instead of bashing robots and enemies
hoursPlayed:
you try to survive zombies. It is an interesting take for a complete makeover of the campaign and the game tries to explain the story while you progress at least!

Magical Zombie Mystery Caper (Zombie Mode Old style)
This is your known zombie mode from previous CoD games except it is set in the '40s. For those loving this
voteText: you will be right at home in this mode and with friends

votesHelpful:
I have found myself having more fun with Left 4 Dead 1&2 and Killing Floor 1&2.

MultiPlayer
I haven't played this mode much

reviewText: In my time of playing, I pretty much enjoyed all aspects of it. You have Campaign, Multiplayer, and Zombies. The movement system is very well implemented and it just feels natural. However, there are multiple issues that needs to be fixed. The biggest is the server issues and while it isn't always messed up, its pretty annoying when it happens. The game also has some optimization issues that will most likely be fixed in the future.\n\nVerdict: Depends really. If you buy COD every year then this is a no brainer. However if you are still skeptical (as I was at first) I would wait for some of the issues to be fixed.

First used optimal settings with the nVidia GeForce Experience.  I kept getting random frame drops to 25 fps.  These drops happened sometimes when I was in battle but they also happened when I wasnt fighting anyone.  No one around me and I would drop to 25 fps.  I then manually switched all my settings to low.  Still the same thing.  For these reasons I have to give this game a thumbs down.

reviewText:
Just to let you know that I am big fan of Call Of Duty every since the 1st Modern Warfare, and not just a d*ckhe#d who thinks that all of the Call Of Duty games are $hit...

I'll try to keep this short,
I feel that the last couple of Call Of Duty games to come out are starting to bleed together as they feel and look very similar. Yes, theres new guns, maps, ect but at the end of the day, are you happy paying £39.99-£69.99 on basicly just that?
And also, ever since they started doing all of this future $hit I feel like I'm playing a knock off of Titanfall or Halo. That's not the Call Of Duty I grow up with, there weren't d*ckhe#ds jumping all over the place and even walking on the walls (even tho it's pretty cool).

At the end of the day I feel that this is going to be the last Call Of Duty I'll be buying, unless they change their ways...

Would I recommend this game... Na, I wouldn't.

reviewText:
To start off: Framerates Framerate issues are big in Campaign, Nightmare (Campaign mixed with zombies), and the zombies map Shadows of Evil. Campaign, during intense particle effects frames visibly dip below 60. It is the same with Nightmare mode. Shadows of Evil map freezes when moving from one section of the map to another. Shadows of Evil is virtually un-playable for most computers.



Zombies:      (Shadows of Evil):   Zombies  has become tedious. It may take 30-80 minutes to get completely set up on this map. Shadows of Evil is very similar to Treyarch's previous map, Tranzit. Tranzit similar to Shadows of Evil is a large map comprised of zones which are all used in order to get all the items possible. The power however works by using a monster that can be used each round to turn on the power of specific areas and not covering the whole map.
The map itself has frequent drops in fps when moving through zones of the map. The game tries to pull off the distinct style of the early 20th century and succeeds at it. Big Band Jazz plays before every round and sounds absolutely great! The architecture looks similar to the architecture in Bioshock Infinite. Tall skyscrapers and small shops.
The enemies include: Zombies, Rolling Exploding Meatballs, The Margwa, Mosquitos, and The Gatekeepers. The enemies  are very original. The problem with the Margwa it spawns far too often. Every 3 rounds. The Margwa is hard to kill. It would be very fun to play against if only its spawn timers were longer.


(The Giant):  Comes with the Season Pass. An amazing map. The map is much better than Shadows of Evil. The map is simple and opening the Pack-A-Punch is far easier. There is no need to search anything up on this map to get it's full experience.
The map is absolutely gorgeous. The lighting is superb and it blows away the previous renditions of the map. There are small differences in the map such as having a different timeline as all Nazi symbols have been removed and replaced with Germany's flag during World War I.
Perks have been randomized and weapons from World at War are no longer in the game. The weapons have been replaced with guns with similar stats but more modern. The M1911 is no longer in the game as well. An iconic weapon marking Nazi Zombies now gone. The perks have also been changed. Their locations are now randomized making the game just a bit harder.
Training on the map is also a lot harder than in previous games. Most players use the Catwalk to get to higher rounds.

Multiplayer:
The multiplayer has become more complicated every new installment. The movement makes the game for more complex than it's predecessors. The game allows characters to choose between certain classes. Classes change the playstyle. Some classes might be better at tanking, others might be better at sniping and so forth.
The amount of guns is ridiculous. Most guns feel equally powerful which is good but makes them feel generic. What would make the guns better would be if each gun in each category made the playstyle completely different, similar to games like CS:GO where each gun has it's purpose.
Perks are far less game changing than before. They give the player less power than before but with skill allow the player to make their class better than the enemy's.
Killstreaks are similar to earlier Black Ops installments.

Nightmare
Nightmare mode is a very fun mode to play with friends or solo. It brings an original experience of mixing Campaign and Zombies. The Nightmare mode has frequent lag spikes due to the zombies and other enemies on screen and the complexity of the enviroments. The AI for the NPC's the player is forced to play with is absolutely horrible. One thing to be grateful for is that the AI is always in God-Mode.
The difficulty of Nightmare Mode is minimal. Realistic is extremely easy and with friends is even easier. However reviving each other when one player goes down will restart the mission to the closest checkpoint which is very infuriating for players. The mode is an interesting concept but ends up feeling mediocre and forgettable.

In Conclusion:
The game has a lot of content. Multiplayer has a lot of content already in the game and will have you playing for hours. Zombies only has one map, which isn't very good.  If you want Zombies to be fun and get the best experience possible, buy the Deluxe Edition or buy future DLC.  Nightmare mode is fun but feels mediocre and forgettable. And if you're a big fan of campaign that will add even more hours to the game. So all in all I recommend this game.

reviewText:
It would seem Tryarch have saved the COD franchise for me, this title is really good fun, and you can play the SP campaign with up to 4 player coop (your friends or random on-line players). Finding a game so far is easy (This might change when DLC drops), I have the Season pass and pre-order bonus maps (Nuke Town & Giant),
Nuke Town is the smallest map in BO3 so far.
Giant is the old COD 5 (WAW) zombie map, with new toys and sharper graphics.
In short if you liked the cod titles before they messed up (I.M.O COD MW3 and onwards), you will love this game.
I hope they have put the likes of Ghosts and Advance War-fighter behind them.
Tryarch as always saves this game just when I thought the final nail had gone in the coffin!

reviewText:
W.I.P Review - (Work In Progress)

EDIT: Treyarch implemented Micro-Transactions and therefore I no longer recommend this game unless they remove them, it is just pure greed from developers that is destroying their game, also they have capped graphics settings so you are now forced to play at low - mid range graphics settings unless you have a pro beastmode super mlg computer. There are literally no games in the world that im aware of where the developer has capped graphics purposefully seemingly to just ♥♥♥♥ off its players

Firstly since Black Ops 3 comes as 1 single game on your Steam Games List when you buy it but has 3 modes (Black Ops 3 Campaign, Black Ops 3 Multiplayer & Black Ops 3 Zombies) i will be reviewing them all here split into thier own sections to make it easier to see which part of the game i will be reviewing.

Black Ops 3 - Campaign
Over the past few CoD titles there have been all kinds of Campaign missions from blowing things up, stealthing your way through patrolling enemies, flying or controlling various vehicles of mass destruction and even venturing into space! So it should be expected of Treyarch to have a very similar style of missions.

However, Treyarch are the big daddies when it comes to all things Call of Duty and generally have always had better content than Infinity Ward or the more recent Sledgehammer titles. Here in the Black Ops 3 Campaign they do not disappoint. Straight away you are dropped into a familiar CoD mission, which seems no different from any other previous CoD campaign mission but right after finishing the first mission you are thrown into the second mission where things start to get a little more interesting.

Treyarch have done a fantastic job here, creating great tension and suspense moments throughout the campaign and it really shows that they have put a great deal of effort into creating something new and exciting that hasnt been done before in previous CoD campaigns. Campaign is also once again 4 player Co-Op if you play online which is the first time since World at War which brings the usual Singleplayer Campaigns into more of a multiplayer enviroment.

Black Ops 3 now introduces Biometric and Cybernetic enhancements to your character. These enhancements are a completely new feature to the CoD franchise and allow your character to do so much more to the enemies such as releasing waves of 'fireflies' at them to eat away at their health and set them on fire, or taking control of enemy robotics or turrets to use against them. This does change how you can approach each mission and is a very welcome new feature to a dwindling CoD Campaigns that were starting to become a little stale and repetitive.

Something else that is new to Black Ops 3 Campaign is a safehouse! This is somewhere you can relax a little inbetween missions. You are able to edit your loadout here and also use 'fabrication kits' that are aquired for completing missions or challenges in the campaign to unlock new weapons or Biometric/Cybernetic enhancements. You are also able to change your characters clothing and gender/appearance here too! Collectibles within Black Ops 3 has also had a complete overhaul from previous CoD titles. Now instead of collecting 50 or so computer intel or tablet intel, Treyarch have placed much more varied items into missions that can be collected then put onto display next to your bunk bed in the safehouse. These can be anything from minature models to various robot components or helmets/hats and some of them have glass display cases too!!

Not only are there Biometric/Cybernetic enhancements and new collectibles but also there are now Medals that you can earn and display in your safehouse too. These are reletively difficult to get and will definitly require you to play through most if not all of the campaign multiple times.

Lastly Treyarch have included with the Biometric/Cybernetic enhancements to your character, something called Tactical View. This shows you dangerzones in the area where you are likely to be shot or killed, it shows blast proximity of grenades or rpg's and also any enemies can be seen through walls when either you or one of your allies can see them. This Tactical View can be toned down or even turned off completely via the options menu when in the safehouse or during a mission so its not forced upon you.

Also just to put the icing on the cake Treyarch show that they have gone all out this time by adding a nice surprise once you complete the campaign mode :P

Black Ops 3 - Multiplayer
Having played Multiplayer for around 5 hours, i have to say its definitely a fun experience! There are 9 Specialists that you can choose from to use and each has thier own special weapon/ability and seeing other players spraying fire and smashing to the ground with gravity spikes does give the game a more futuristic and slightly theatrical appearance as opposed to realistic, but i have thouroughly enjoyed playing this mode so far.

A few things i have noticed while playing is that if you join a game while it is already in progress and your team loses or you lose, then it says at the end 'Loss stat prevented due to joining game in session' or something which means that your stats are not biased by joining a losing battle like previous CoD games.

Also having read community forums for this game recently, there do appear to be alot of people struggling to join games, i have had no issues with this and joined every game and lobby so far in around 2 seconds which seems if anything faster than previous CoD titles that i have played.

Black Ops 3 - Zombies
There are two Zombies maps upon the games release (assuming you bought the Season Pass) and a new Perk-like feature called Dr Montys Factory in which you can use something called Liquid Divinium to brew up Gumballs. Liquid Divinium is aquired in either of the two zombies maps by purchasing weapons from the wall, opening doors, buying perks and using the mystery box. As for the Gumballs, they can drop power ups, give you faster aiming and running speed, allow you to teleport across the map and so on.

There is also now a levelling and experience gaining feature for the zombies mode, you can prestige upto 10th zombies prestige and also level up weapons, earn camos and attachments for the weapons that you can then use in game straight off the wall or from the mystery box.

The Giant

The Giant zombies map is a Der Reise remake from the World at War CoD title, playing this map after so many years just brought with it so much nostalgia! The map itself is pretty much unchanged, but there are the new Gumball machines that have been introduced to the zombies mode and new perk machines. Also the weapons are the Black Ops 3 weapons instead of the World at War weapons. Personally i feel like the weapons themselves are generally more overpowered than the World at War counterparts and getting to round 30 solo seems like no problem at all.

Shadows of Evil

This zombies map is much larger than The Giant, while i have played this map, i haven't played it extensivly enough to review it just yet. Having said that, from what i have seen there are the usual several perk machines, summoning rituals, portals, new wonder weapons and so much more. The traditional Easter Egg steps for zombies mode seems far more complex and seems to take ideas from almost every previous zombies map all implemented into one. It is definitly a fun map to play and i cannot wait to play it more in depth!

reviewText:
The port has gotten better, but the optimization has a lot to be desired. I have an i5 and a GTX 750 ti, and according to the minimum specs of needing an okay i3 and a GTX 470, I should have been in the clear. Yet, I can hardly play at full res(1440x900 for me) with 60 fps. After a series of updates and everything on low, I can finally accomplish this steady framerate.

But why is framerate important? CoD has a poor system of basing your aiming sensitivity to your frames per second, so maintaining a solid framerate that does NOT FLUCTUATE is very important. Playing even at 45 fps or 30 fps made the game perform different and unstable from my experience.

Now, I bought the game for the multiplayer, and only TDM has a decent amount of players. Disappointing, because I enjoyed having every mode active when I played CoD on consoles in the franchise's prime. It becomes stale rather fast.

Lastly, do not use a controller online. The players with keyboard and mouse are much more accurate than what you can be with an analog stick.

TL;DR - Mediocre port with lackluster multiplayer modes available due to community playing mostly TDM. There is content, but may not be enjoyable unless you are fortunate to run the game well.

reviewText:
When I first got the game, I honestly really enjoyed it and had no issues with the game whatsoever. Considering I hadn't played cod since MW3, the game definately felt like a good one to get back into. Multiplayer is enjoyable with a lot of new features that I love like custom camos and the cryptokey system, while some weapons are kinda a bit too strong in my opinion. Zombies seem much more complicated and a definate improvement from the last time I played zombies on the original blackops and it is something I really want to get into more. The campaign is there, but I never really feel too compelled to go play it.


Despite the fact that it had a bad launch, the game has been running perfectly fine on my i5 4690k - R9 390 rig ever since I originally bought it. Well, that was untill my friend bought it so we could play zombies together...
Now, every single time I load into anything, the game crashes after about 10 seconds in. I could sit anywhere on the main menu without crashing forever, but the second I load into zombies, I crash. Load into multiplayer? Crash. Load into singleplayer? Crash. The only possible reasons I could possibly think of that caused this to happen now, is that either A, the most recent patch screwed things up for me or B, my steam controllers drivers (Got the controller today) did something.


Supposedly, some people still have trouble running the game. I tried running it on my old 7770 - FX 6300 rig and it couldnt even run on the lowest possible settings on anywhere near acceptable frames. Keep in mind that back in the day, this old rig was able to run Crysis 3 on high settings with playable and acceptable frames rates.


Honestly, I hate to write a negative review because I enjoyed the game when I was able to play it. But considering the fact that the game is now completely unplayable unless I was to make the mona lisa of emblems, I have give it a negative review for now. It wouldn't be so bad if there was a fix anywhere on any forum that I come across, but unfortunately I can't find a single one

reviewText:
I was hoping too actually get into Call of Duty again after playing so many hours on Modern Warfare 2 back on the Xbox 360. But sadly enough this game just killed it even more than I was hoping it would. After a long wait of not playing a single Call of Duty since MW2 and never experienced the goofy Black Ops series this was a hope, but it would kill the serie for me entirely.

The multiplayer was interesting too say the least, but the only thing that would keep me playing it was the movement system. Sliding, wallrunning, hoovering etc. It was that interesting concept that wanted me too keep trying the multiplayer more and more. Other than that it just felt like any other Call of Duty with better grapich, different weapon and just a more advanced system too change a class.

Zombies was the one thing I was really excited for, since it would be my first time experiencing it in Call of Duty. It was fun in the beginning with my mate but eventually the entertainment it could offer slowly killed it for both of us. It wasn't as excited as people had hyped it too be. After 3 games of it I eventually quit and there was the end for me in Black Ops 3.

I know already a lot of people buys this game for the multiplayer, and rarely for the campaign. But I don't wanna say a lot about the campaign because if there's something that really grind my gears about Call of Duty is the campaign in each game. They are boring, lack charisma and is just outdraged. The last good campaign I enjoyed was what Modern Warfare 1 and 2 had too offer. Maybe it's more opinion driven but I just felt more into it than this one.

At the end of the day I feel like this isn't just my kind of game. The serie died out for me in Modern Warfare 2 and it's gonna stay there probably. I just can't get into the same concept of a game and stick with the series and keep supporting a company that sh*ts out 1 game every year where there's almost no change too it. I hope people enjoy this more than I do, and make the best out of it. But I just can't recommend it at the end.

reviewText:
First things first.
Specs:
Windows 7,
Intel i5 4 cores [3.1 GHz],
16 GB ram,
NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti,

But why does the game run like garbage, i mean it's released 6 Nov, 2015...

Ingame i have 60 fps, but when something happens like some one is shooting it goes down to 40 fps, and another example when i'm near water or in water, the fps goes down to 30fps. Overall after a short period time it gave me a headache. [On low-medium graphic]

The matchmaking is garbage or non existing.
You are a lvl 1 and get thrown in a lobby with lvl 60+ player.

The gunplay:
The gunplay feels like you're shooting with water pistols, there is no real weight behind the weapons. And then the time you need to kill someone...  ...3 shots [I know that some people might like this, i don't.]

Over all the game feels like arcade and it seems like that skill is not really needed. [just fast reactions]

So would i recommend this game?
No,

but if you like,
Cheap and quick deaths,
Unfair killstreaks and
a bad pc port,

then go ahead buy it for just: 100 euro. [For every thing]

reviewText: Ok, let's start off here. I have NO issues with performance, and the game is perfectly smooth, other then the occasional stutter or whatever it may be. The dedis are fine, I havent experienced any lag whatsoever as far as that. It's a new release, there's gonna be bugs, there's gonna be issues, and it makes me sort of sad to see ALL these bad reviews about game performance, when the game itself is perfectly fine. No one understands developers have to be able to optimize the game for the millions of different hardware configurations out and it does take time most of the time. But I've noticed most people are complaining the game isnt optimized, and they're trying to run it on high settings with a 650 and other lower end cards, and 70% of those bad reviews are generally due to people not understand how textures work. I have a 4770k and a 980 STRIX. The game uses a little over 3gb for me with high textures, therefore anyone trying to do that on low end cards with less then 3GB of VRAM just arent going to get good performance, it simply wont work with ANY game. It's not the devs fault for that. The game is AMAZING, one of my fav cods so far. And I tend to only like treyarch games recently anyway as they're always the best optimized and fit my playstyle. But patches will come, the game will get better.

reviewText:
Looks like a really promising sequel, great maps & campaign looks promising.
Unfortunately had to get mine refunded as it's pretty much unplayable in it's current state.

I could play online fine solo, zombies fine solo, campaign fine. The minute I attempted multiplayer a whole bunch of things screwed up. The particle effects were out of control; walls jittering all over the place, bots disappearing, roads glowing, sky falling, you name it. The FPS was a mess even after lowering all the settings the lag was unbearable. And after every game (even single player) there was a random blue screen for a good ten seconds before going back to the game menu.
Definitely issues with memory leak, on lowest settings and from the minute I loaded the game my task manager was showing 100% usesage and the game crashes after being on for any more than 20 minutes.
It really sucks, as the maps and customisation look like a decent follow on from BO2 and I'll definitley re-buy it once I'm sure all the issues are fixed, but being as I use it mainly for multiplayer it's really not worth £40 just sitting in my library.

I'm genuinly quite surprised Treyarch haven't issued a statement at least acknowledging everyones issues yet, I know patches (especially ones this big!) take a while to roll out and there are soooo many operating systems to get feedback from for optimization but please at least give your disappointed buyers a clue of when to expect a fix, a game shouldn't be sent to release if it isn't ready, even if you've spent a ton of money on marketing it for a specific date..
voteText: 19 of 33 people (58%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A fantastic game with with new twists and treasures that make a classic design refreshing, rewarding, and incredibly fun. All of the modes are each given proper attention, with separate ranking systems and unlocks for each mode (Campaign, Multiplayer, Zombies). The graphics are good - nothing to leave your wife over - but they are good for today's standards. The game runs well despite a few uncomfortable glitches, like me being immobile for a few seconds every time I join a match.

I give this game a 9/10, would Call this Duty again. Below I shall go into more details regarding each mode (no spoilers of course).

CAMPAIGN
Story wise, the campaign is horrible. Even though this bears the Black Ops insignia, it is completely unrelated to the Black Ops universe. I have enjoyed the levels, but I could care less about nearly every one of the characters, even the Player character (who is literally named 'Player'). Not any memorable moments or interesting characters like in Black Ops or Modern Warfare. 5/10

MULTIPLAYER
Classicly addicting Call of Duty gameplay with the jet-pack twist of Advanced Warfare. It makes for some great fun, but retains the same elements I have loved since Modern Warfare 2. 10/10

ZOMBIES
Do not be fooled by the outrageous maps put out by Treyarch. They stay true to the zombies storyline and experience, just as they have even when we were on the moon, in ww1 with robots, and in the factory that started it all. The gameplay is challenging, convuluted, and full of suprises. The map is interesting. The characters, theme, and style of the mode are all fun and great. It makes for incomparable fun when experienced with your friends in a private game. Searching for a game can be difficult though, because most people do not like to communicate, which has become essential to the mode. 9/10

reviewText: I usually don't review games because no matter how much one may like or dislike it, it's an opinion. Most of the time that is true. But this game is so awful at it's core that I can't respect anybody who likes it in it's current state. This review completely disregards all of the game's shortcomings in terms of performance and optimization because bugs and glitches are to be expected upon the release of any game.\n\nAny strategic or tactical approach to this game is cut short by the random movements and overpowered abilities aka specialists. Any effort to play a tactical game is cut short by the hectic and poorly designed maps where people pop out of nowhere and the game becomes a game of luck. Or more accurately, a random game. Even if you don't mind your skills being equalized for the sake of keeping the game friendly for beginners and casuals, you'll likely end up frustrated as you have to focus more on spotting people than you do actual combat for the player models blend into the environment so well. This would be nice if this were a war simulator but it's everything but that. Call of Duty was born out of an arena-esque battle scene and that's what it is loved for. Even if we disregard the fact that player models and the environment are relatively the same shades, everything in the game is so detailed making you unable to focus on the actual game. Trying to aim down a corridor? Well, turns out you're aiming at books on a bookshelf and not an actual player... and you're dead because the opponent decided to go for a swim.

reviewText:
I cannot recommend this game.  I enjoy Zombies, and some of the other single player stuff, but whenever I'm partied with another player the game becomes unplayable.  To be honest, I only bought this game for Zombies, and the occasional multiplayer, but the slightest lag and you are dead.  You think you're clear of a doorway and then you rubberband into the frame.  You think you killed a zombie with a headshot from a shotgun, and he eats your face.  The fact that I get stuck on blades of grass, it feels, makes the experience frustrating and not very enjoyable.  I don't know, maybe the game is better on console, but I'm not buying it again.

Pros: Zombies

Cons: If you have even slightly slower internet than an opponent, you die.
If you haven't been playing from day 1, be prepared to be outclassed instantly
If you want to play multiplayer, prepare for 20-30 minutes wait if you want to play something other than Core TDM
Killcams clearly show other players hitting you for headshots without even aiming in your direction


Bottom line, if you enjoy CoD, you'll probably enjoy this game.  It has all the same problems the other games have had, and even some new ones to deal with.  This is the last CoD game I'll be buying, but that's just me.

reviewText:
So let's start, I got addicted to this game as soon as I got it... That was after it took an hour to even get the game to start. Keep in mind, this game is not well optimized, you will most likely get errors, etc, at startup. I managed to fix them all. After this horrible experience, and I could actually start the game, I got addicted to this!

I am a Zombies player, so I mostly play Zombies, but who doesn't play Campaign and at least tries out the Multiplayer? The Campaign was average, with an average story in my honest opinion. I hate the fact that there's a new cast in this, and not the characters from BO1 or BO2, except some mentionings of them, but that's all. Treyarch, you're not that lazy to use the choices made in BO2 to continue the story here, right? Anyway, after the dissappointment of Campaign, I went to play Multiplayer. I suck at Multiplayer. I suck real bad. The way your character moves is a LOT better than Advanced Crapware. As I didn't play Multiplayer that much, I don't really have anything to say about it, forgive me.

Now, Zombies... The mode which I love... This mode was AMAZING... except the fact that Shadows of Evil is one of their worst maps in my honest opinion. Not only did they make it harder (not really a problem for me), but to unlock Pack a Punch, you have to perform four rituals in every game. But that's not the annoying thing, the annoying thing, and PLEASE Treyarch fix this just like you did in BO2... When the host ends, the game ends. I cannot tell you how many times I've been over Round 20 and the host downs once and rage quits and then I see those unforgiveable, horrible words which tell me the Game has ended... Oh not to mention the fact that you have REMOVED THE READY UP" FEATURE! Treyarch
date: don't try to fix things which aren't broken... The Ready Up feature is important for me

and if I am ready to play or not.

I give this game a 7/10.
It might bring the series back alive

reviewText:
Full of Zombies stuff and genuine innovation. Blops 3 has great art design with a real effort put in to make things interesting and fun. Zombies fans in particular will get a lot out of this game, with first person Dead Ops Arcade 2 and other major Zombies easter eggs spread over Campaign and multiplayer modes. Theres loads of fun stuff to do and unlock, Im really enjoying it. Im also looking forward to the Zombies DLC :)

The Der Riese reskin, The Giant is one of my favourite things so far. They added really fun new gameplay elements with great music and lighting effects/animations. If this is anything to go by, the Zombies DLC maps are gonna be amazing.

Blops 3 is a great sequel, a really high quality game and an impressive effort by Treyarch. There is so much amazing stuff in the game, it is more like a developer package than a single game, like the Orange Box from Valve. Anyway, its well worth the 100 euro I paid and the DLC is still to come with more zombies goodness :)

Just watch Preston's videos,, he has to reboot every game or the fps will cripple his gameplay. Activision is too worried about feeding their wallets than to fix any proformance issues. It is a awesome game but there is no point when there is constant lag and fps issues within the game itself. Buy at your own risk. The way it is now... reviewText: I had to much HYPE for this game, I preordered it on the first day it was available. I'm really not impressed, from it's extremely poor optimization for PC users, having to run it on low settings with a very capable computer. The game lags at the beginning of every match for a few seconds whilst the map loads in. Hitmarkers are for days.  Aim assist for controller support - why use mouse and keyboard anymore? LOLs. Blue screen between every match that hasn't been fixed yet. Feels like a game that wasn't competely tested before release. However - Zombies is beautiful and amazing, love it. Campaign has an awesome storyline and alot of effort has been put into that. Fix Multiplayer and the game will become Recommended.

reviewText:
One of the better COD games that have been released lately. It has some really fun mechanics such as wallrunning, stair sliding and swimming. Makes for a variated gameplay.

Negative things: Micro transactions, laggy servers and a kinda lame community(people are rude af). It's sometimes hard to find lobbies and/or decent hosts.

Still, I keep coming back to it, it's entertaining and keeps me occupied with challanges and different game modes.

Conclusion: it's a good game. Fun at times.

PS; please dont spend money on COD points, that ♥♥♥♥ is stupid.

reviewText:
I don't know why I do it.

I keep thinking CoD will somehow bring itself back from the grave, but they insist on producing something that is either too buggy to actually play or refuse to include dedicated servers in their game.

To be honest, the gameplay is actually pretty good. But the only reason I bought this game was to play with my buddies. Every time we try to party up, we drop from party and end up just talking over teamspeak about how our day was instead of playing the game. Don't get the wrong, the lobby of BO3 is lovely. But I'd rather actually play a game that I payed for than sit in its lobby. Call of Duty has been heading in the wrong direction for some time now. Unfortunately the franchise doesn't seem to take the PC community seriously.
