Singleplayer is also very bad, the cutscenes and just the general feeling is very bad. The storyline is not something that takes you in the game.
Zombies is very good, but with the bad optimization of the game makes it not that enjoyable.

reviewText:
Disclaimer: My review focus' on the online multiplayer portion of the game because I played during the free multiplayer weekend. By the way no one plays this game online.
-So here's the poop
It's call of duty, what do you expect at this point I mean really? You are either a ♥♥♥♥♥ who plays it because of peer presure from dumb ♥♥♥ friends or some weird type of non gamer who feels obligated to buy the same broken game every year, luckily I'm neither.
-Performance
This pc port was some fine garbage, the games audio is disabled when using more then 2 speakers so i have to disable surround sound in my operating system just to get audio working. The game runs smooth when it's not crashing randomly on menus or freezing trying to load a match, decent performance as far as frames per second goes but I will say i get much higher fps on games that are more visually complex.
-Gameplay
The gameplay itself hasnt changed except for wall running which is actually very fun, wall running and the explosive bow and arrow are the best part of this game, it's so satisfying sharp shooting with a explosive bolt. The level design is focused around the wall running mechanic and the levels over all seem more arena like which i enjoy in a game like this, but the maps are often turned stupid when people use the rolling robot perks, it's total explosion spam. The character selection is weird, it's all female and one cyborg male who happens to be black, thank you social justice..
-Verdict
I can't play anything other then team death match and death match because no one plays this ♥♥♥♥ online (atleast for pc), I feel like steam users or pc gamers in general are becomming more aware of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t games and ignore them better then console gamers do, and thank God because I'm sick of main stream gaming being the same thing year after year. This game isnt worth purchasing but I will say it's the funnest call of duty since 2007.

reviewText:
Edit
It  actually runs silky smooth for me. Unlike others. But good news that eventually at the same day of the launched date Treyarch immediately updated it and most of the people can play it silky smooth already.

Note
I'm going to review the game based on itself, not on the performance like everyone in the COD community has. Yes, the game has some performance issues but for now turning down the settings and working with Treyarch by leaving constructive feedback for them to improve on is better than not playing.

Original
I was bored playing Call of Duty series because they were repeating/putting same stuffs in the game.
But I have no reason for Call of Duty Black Ops 3 because they have brought so many innovations that actually make me excited for it.

1.  Love the idea that they have brought Call of Duty to futuristic style. (even more futuristic)   I know some people out there they actually hate this idea because they prefer how realistic Call of Duty was in the past. But come on… I’m actually bored already. Talking about realistic I would prefer Arma 3 or Battle Field.


2.   The campaign mode builds for replayability   Treyarch has taken to describing the levels as “arenas”, allowing players to tackle objectives from a variety of angles while working cooperatively with friends.

Yes, bingo! With friends. Players will be able to play the campaign together in 4-player online co-op. (even 2 player split-screen support included as well.)


3.  Weapon Customization    Weapon modification is nothing new for the franchise, but the weapon paint shop does add an extra layer to the extensive customization we've previously seen. Distinctive camouflage can be equipped to almost any weapon, and the weapon paint shop goes beyond simple emblem editors.

These emblems can be displayed on either side of your weapon, letting your enemy know exactly who destroyed them this round. You can literally create anything you want - with up to 64 layers and three different areas to design to express yourself in your weapon. Talking about customization, I’ll jump to number 4 reason which is……


4.   Increased Customization    For the first time in the history of Call of Duty, players will be able to completely customize their campaign character, including their gender. This is a significant departure from the franchise norm, but Treyarch is hoping to make a gender-neutral storyline for the campaign that all players can enjoy.


5.   Zombies return    Treyarch brings back Zombies with a vengeance in Black Ops 3 and fans of the game mode should be ecstatic at the additions.
First of all, it appears that Zombies will have a full-fledged story this time around; at least it will be more fleshed out than before.
Secondly, XP progression system is being implemented, which will greatly increase the mode’s replayability.

Not a whole lot is known yet about Zombies, but mystery is part of what makes is exciting.


6.   Multiplayer Specialist    This approach to game design is more in line with hero-based MOBAs like Dota as opposed to what one has come to expect from a first-person shooter. These Specialists all have their own personality, unique weapons, and special abilities, including a time-traveling robot named Reaper.

The introduction of Specialists is an extreme departure from what the multiplayer has represented in past entries.

Will these Specialists change the pace of the game to the point that it doesn’t even truly feel like Call of Duty? The potential for failure here only further adds to the excitement, as it will be incredibly interesting to see if Treyarch’s big gamble pays off.


7.  Nuk3town returns.    Nuk3town was one of the most popular multiplayer maps in the original Call of Duty: Black Ops. But this time is with futuristic style, which is really cool.


8.  Prestige mode will be totally new and different   Full details on Prestige have not been announced. This will be something to look forward. Yeaph, something mysterious is the part of interesting part.

reviewText:
This game makes me regret the $60 I spent becuase it is unplayable. First when I started, I bought this game because I played the other Black Ops and loved them, but that was on console. PC is a different story but my most major complain is the multiplayer.
SinglePlayer:
The singleplayer may take you a couple of hours to pass, but its the most innovative singleplayer I have seen so far for a Call of Duty game. The story is in my opinion, kinda corny. The protagonist, you, were heavily injured in the end of the prologue and were ripped of your limbs and then is when you recover and then join the Black Ops squad. At the beginning of each level, the game sets you in your own safehouse where you can change your preset of 3 types of abilities, in which you can upgrade over time, you can make up your class with the weapons you want, the game gives you a bios of the purpose of the mission, and sets the scale of each leave if its either close quaters, mid size, or long range, but it doesn't really matter. I stayed with the same weapon and abilities since I started the campaign and I got through the game with that class. You can play the campaign in coop with your other buddies, but this is when the game really goes downhill.

Multiplayer:
The multiplayer has improved and has brougth new features. You still have your classic TDM, Kill Confirmed, etc, and new gamemodes like Vanguard and such, but TOO BAD YOU CAN ONLY PLAY TDM AND DOMINATION. My biggest dissapointment is that matchmaking on PC sucksssss. Every time I got searching for a match that has any other gamemode besides TDM and Domination, it is completely empty. I can't confirm if its either the community or the NAT Type which most are set to moderate but you can attempt to set it at open and see if you are lucky enough to find a single match o kill confirmed with a couple of players in it. The connectivity is okay, I haven't found myself ever losing connection to a game.

Zombies:
The Zombies gamemode suffers from the same big problem that multiplayer contracts, you can't find a single match, and when you do you will have to fight through the lag. My multiplayer ping is an average of 45 but in zombies, IT GOES UP TO THE 100S AND THEN EVEN HIGHER, and its not like you can play with a full match of 4, you will stay stuck trying to find someone to play zombies with. Another downside, the only map the game has isn't that much fun. Black Ops 2 Transit Zombies Map was huge and had alot of fun stuff to do. Blacks Ops 1 has better zombies than Blacks Ops 3.

Optiminisation:
This game had problems at the beginning with framrates going up and down, even on high end GPUs like NVIDIA's GEFORE GTX 970 4GB Graphics Cards, but the game has been updated with pathces and I can finalyy play the game with max shadows without my framesdropping like they used to before.

Nightmare Mode:

Nightmare mode is basically a remix of the singleplayer but with zombies. Sadly, I found nightmare mode way more interesting than the actual singleplayer story. You can also play that in co-op. Nothing much else to say.

Final Verdit:
5/10
My verdict would have been at least a 6 if I can play my other favorite gamemodes like kill confirmed.

reviewText:
I Plan On Updateing my Review Frequently*
I Love the Game , But Its Not what It Should be.

They fixed all below but off sea severs .

-Serious performance issues using past the Reccomened reqiurments over 8gb of ram and is unoptimized Poorly even with Updates using Past 8gb of Ram.
-Users unable to make Clan tags or emblems or paintjob
-Being thrown into Over Seas Severs .
-The Unpacking of the Game Normal Takes longer than the Download for Most Users So the Preload Is Useless/Was Useless.
-Intel I5 Users Where Unable to Play for 3 days after lanuch .
-Majour Game breaking Glitches in Game
-Zombies Is more Glitchly Than The Mulitiplayer Beta.
-Turning On the Power In Zombies Can Cause Users to Crash Or stutter ..
-High ping Has been Reported for Users With Subpair internet.
-Systems Not running the game even Requirments
-Reports
-Constantly resets microphone level to random values.
-Serious lockups when playing
-Most Intel CPUs do not Run the Game (Fixed Day 8 Patch)
-Unable to close game without reset
-Resets audio devices
-,Major camera stutter when running and turning at the same time
-Controller Lag on PS4 Remotes
-when Using an Xbox & Ps4 Controllers the PS4 controller is only able to choose their class / Open the menu.
-Campain Is poorly Optimized
Heres My Release Day Story.
I had a room full of 12 People Waiting for this game to Unpack On a Samsung Evo for 3+ Hrs So we Could Play Spilt Screen & Stream To Youtube.
In that case the game After the Wait of the Unpacking ,
Started a whole New Story.
The Game Played the Intro & Went Black Did nothing stay at a Capped 60 FPS,
i Closed the game after awhile thinking it was Setting itself up.
But it took 2 try to start Up the game .
Than to Notice that it takes about 3 Minutes to start up as i just put it in backround & started hearing sound as we Where all Watching Netflix.
So i Booted it up , Played a game of Mulitiplayer ,
Enjoyed myself , seen a few Graphic Related Problems Thought nothing of it for now as i was Recording my Gameplay.
Round finished so i decided to go try zombies , But before i could do anything their was no loading screen in the load from mulitiplayer to the xp menu thing.
It was pure blue.
So i went on to Zombies ,
Gosh.
Everybody was Drop from the Game Besides myself & one other player.
When we turned on the Power It glitched someone out & they just logged of.
the Next person was Playing till we Got to round 16 , The Dogs came.
It lagged him out so hard with his mouse movements that he had to Backout of the game.

Its sad to say this may be the Next Batman Game,
I think it should have Been a EA Game .

Im Going to Continue to Post Videos Of this Game & Helpfull tips , Any Questions Feel free to Ask.
But i Honestly Love this Game but its Not what it should be ,
Im hoping Updates will Change it .

reviewText:
Not a terrible game, but there are way too many different melee weapons in the game imo, and you'll likely come across many lobbies full of people meleeing, especially on small maps.

I played this game a lot simply trying to unlock dark matter and the specialist hero armors, without setting those goals, I would have spent much less time playing the game.

The game itself is fairly fast paced, not balanced all that well, three lane everywhere (most of the time very strict three lane), it gets pretty repetitive most of the time, same with other cod games.

I'll try out infinite warfare as I prefer Infinity ward's mechanics over Treyarchs. Oh, and Battlefield 1 looks fun, I'm a big fan of history and it looks like Battlefield 1 will be following historical weapons, vehicles and locations very closely.



BO3-Decent game, fast paced, not well balanced, thruster things, op specialists.

reviewText:
tl;dr the zombies is f-awesome! I'm not too keen on the multiplayer, I miss CoD4/WaW/BO1 era multiplayer. Will update with campaign once I take a moment from being hooked on the zombies :P

I'm not a CoD multiplayer guy, if you are only in in for the multiplayer this review isn't for you.

I loved everything about World at War and Black Ops 1 - all modes. I hated MW3/BO2/Ghosts/AW. I was just about done with call of duty. But then I watched a stream of BO3 Zombies. And damn it sparked something that was untouched since Black Ops 1. So I decided to pick the game and season pass up on Gee2A. I've had it 1 day and put 13 hours into the game. I just can't put it down - thats saying something as I'm a CS:GO and League of Legends player so most of my time is taken up playing those, I rarely go a day playing a game without looking at either of them.

I'm not keen on the multiplayer so far, I preferred gameplay from CoD4/WaW/BO1. Slightly slower paced and more mindful. Now is feels like unless you are going full tryhard MLG you're not really going to have a fun time here, I'm really not very keen on the jump boost and movement, still feels very Titanfally.
EDIT: I have played a bunch more of the multiplayer and after a few more hours of playing I have really gotten into it, absolutely loving it. Took until about level 15 but from then on I adjusted to the movement and really started going to town. A lot of fun so long as you don't rage from 1-2 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t deaths here and there :P

To conclude, if you loved the zombie gameplay from WaW/BO1, you should love this and it's really worth the money if you get it onsale or from a site like ♥♥♥ or whatever. Even though, personally, I'm not a fan of the Multiplayer, you might love it!

I will update this as and when I finish the campaign, but right now I just want to play Zombies, the new map is especially fun and interesting and is a labyrinth the first few times and always surprises around the corner so far!

reviewText: As a first time CoD-player I have to say that I'm impressed. Im not too much into fps-gaming but this game actually is really fun, full of action and has beautiful graphics. And btw the graphics isn't way too demanding either. I Play on a Gtx980 with maximum settings and I had a 55-80 fps. So go for it!

reviewText:
Don't understand all the bad reviews for the game. This game has been running completey smooth and I havent had a so called crash yet. I've actaully tested it out on new and old hardware and it still runs good and hasn't crashed. People think it should run maxed out on 5-6 year old hardware. Sorry it's not going to happen. Thats why you have new parts come out and need new hardware to run NEW games maxed. Things change and stuff evolves. Before I get all the hate for trying to defend the game...I'm going to tell you the systems I have tryed it on...

1st system:
AMD FX 8350 (stock no oc)
16gb ddr3 1866mhz
HD 7970 3gb...
Almost all medium settings no ambient occlusion Screen res 80% and FXAA-60fps vsync on

2nd system:
I5 4440 (stock no co)
16gb ddr3 1866mhz
Geforce GTX 660 2gb...
Almost all medium settings no ambient occlusion Screen res 80% and FXAA-60fps vsync on

3rd system which is my gaming system:
I7 4790k Devils Canyon (OC'ed 4.6ghz-5ghz boost)
32gb ddr3 2800
EVGA 980ti FTW 6gb
Everything maxed out All goodies on Screen resoloution 200%-60fps vsync on

Have played on all three systems and haven't seen a crash or problem yet. So as far as optimization goes I personally have to give it a big thumbs up.

Now the game itself...I personally think it's fun. Its Cod with polish and more content. Treyarch continues with the Black Ops franchise and does not dissappoint with multiplayer. Sorry have not and probably will not play the campaign. Never do, Zombies portion of the game is really fun but they should have added a few more maps...guessing thats where DLC's will come to play. Sorry Treyarch but DLC's suck just trying to get money for more content that should have been in with the game anyways. But besides that I personally am enjoying the game and give it a thumbs up...all of treyarchs games have been really fun.

reviewText:
Ignore the other post complaining about optimization because that has been fixed with the recent patch that launched on November 14. This game is truley one of the best in the Call of Duty series. Treyarch does care about the pc community and balancing as they have been releasing patch after patch to address bug fixes, Nerfing/buffing weapons, and optimization. I highley recommend getting this game especially with mod support coming in 2016.

There are a few hackers ,it's rare to encounter one, but it seems Treyarch is coming down fullforce with the Ban Hammer on all of them as long as people keep reporting them. The story can be a little complicated, especially near the end but you will have to replay it if you wish to full understand the story. Zombies are back and better than ever.
For 60USD you get:

-Single Player (6-10 hours depending on which difficulty you play on + Tons of secrets to collect, Co-op mode with split screen support)

-Multiplayer  ( Easily hundreds of hours worth of playtime with future mod support for custom maps/modes coming in 2016, Tons of unlocks for weapons, attachments and camos,Custom Emblem creator, Paintshop which basically lets you create your own camo for your gun, gunsmith, co-op with splitscreen support)

-Zombies (It's one map if you don't own the season pass but it's huge with tons of hidden stuff/lore to find and split screen support)

-A freerun mode for praticing wallrunning + leaderboard support so people can compete for the shortest amount of time it took to complete a level.

-A hidden zombie single player campaign ( It's just a rehash of the story missions, in a different order, but with zombies and new dialog/cutscenes and co-op/splitscreen support)

-Dead Ops Arcade 2

Treyarch have truely outdone themselves compared to Black Ops 2.

10/10

reviewText:
As you can see I playd over 450 hours on this game, so I can tell you what the pro's and cons are.

Campaign
- Just a weird storyline, I still can't figure out what happend.

Multiplayer
+ The maps are great
+ Don't have to wait 5 mins, can always find a lobby.
+ Controls are easy, like in every other CoD
+ You can wallrun :D
+ Fast Gameplay
+ You can add 5 attachments to a weapon!
+ Specialists are kinda funny.
- Hackers!!!!
- Aimassist and controller users.
- Everyone complains about Camping/Shotguns
- Pls remove the Supply Drops (Not P2W)
- The guns they added should be for Seasonpass holders only
- Ragequitters!

Zombies
+ Shadows of Evil has some bugs
+ The Giant just a remake but lovely to play!
+ Der Eisendrache, Whoohoo Elena Siegman and Kevin Sherwood are back!!
+ You can customize your own weapons!
+ Gumballs make the game better.
+ Liquid Divinium Cap has been removed!
- Public matches are empty!
- Lost connection to host in a solo match.

- Freerun
+ Dead Ops Arcade
+ Nightmare

Questions?

Put them in my comments

Just an advice...dont be a sheep...dont follow the river of bad reviews,If you really dont like this game there is a refund option

reviewText:
Call of Duty is one of the many games (FPS related) that I play, you cant exactly contrast the game with other FPS games are they have different play styles. Most of the time, Call of Duty is a fast paced shooter with quite a lot going on. Well thats what it seems like to me.

The game is good, dont get me wrong, it is enjoyable to play BUT there are some issues that should be addressed and taken into consideration when you click that add to cart button.

1- What the game has become.

The days of being able to use other weapons in game is over, being able to reliable cover a section of the map with an LMG or Sniper is no longer a play style that can be used. there was nothing that I loved more than being able to mow down 3 guys trying to flank your spawn on DOM. instead the game has become saturated by 1 specific play style.

2- Rush.

I can understand that Call of Duty is a fast FPS game, one of the easiest to play in that matter, you dont have to worry about bulletdrop like Battlefield, you dont have to worry about listening for footsteps or other sniper shots, Sniper Ghost Warrior but there is a limit in which how easy you can make it. both Black ops 2, Ghost and AW (I dont own AW but from friends that have the game) are saturated with the use of SMGs and/or Shotguns, having small maps really makes the efficieny of using a Sniper almost obselete, LMG users are constantly being dominated by the fast firing high DMG smgs you find in BO3, yet when it comes to balancing things....

3- How to guide: Balancing Weapons.

after using the Haymaker 12 for quite sometime now there are a few things that I do not understand
-Somehow, it is the shotgun with the least amount of damage, yet, fires a buckshot, like most of the shotguns in BO3
-I am consistanly getting hate for using the weapon, note most of the people that are hating on me, get to close.

You See, Treyarch fail to see that there is a difference between Balance and butthurt, Balance, is not nerfing the crap out of a weapons to turn it into a waterpistol, that is what you get when a whole bunch of people dont like being killed by the Haymaker, the simple counter measure to a shotgun is to not get so close to someone, simple as that. but when balancing weapons, also take into consideration where the complaints are coming from. This could be from places like reddit, youtube etc, once you read these comments, actually take some time to look at statistics, I am sure you have some spare time while monkeys are fixing the issues with the game to make things right. there is nothing more than seeing a game saturated and dominated by fast firing SMGs with have the range of a sniper... Im not just saying this because I get killed byt SMGs quite a lot, but more so that it is true. for example, if you look at say the Vesper, chuck rapid fire, laser sight and fast mag. You pretty much has a lightweight minigun.

there are positives to the game, the zombies is spot on, I love it!, have enjoyed every single moment of it!, especially when you disconnect from Singleplayer....

Multiplayer, although has a fair amount of issues, is fun.

but my main complaint for the game, is the constant FPS spikes/stutters... any kind of help I look for either says update the drivers or get a better computer... I have updated the drivers, which had pretty much no effect what-so-ever, getting a better computer well, I think I have good enough specks to be honest (i7-2600, HD7950 and 8GB ram).

Dont you find it sad how, supposedly, Creating a sequal to what was quite a good game (Black ops 2) take such a downfall, games are meant for enjoyment, being able to communicate with friends, and all the people that have apparently slept with your mother. Dont you feel dissapointed in YOUR inability to fix the mistakes and become a better overall game developer. Isnt it demoralising when you see that just under 50% of the comments/reviews on the game are Negative? I know this will most likely not been seen by the eyes of any Treyarch developer but all these questions run through my mind. the thing is... what goes through yours...

reviewText:
Ok let me be extremely honest right now, I'm one of those guys, the ones that love to insult the call of duty games, but I at least give them a shot before doing so, I had high hopes for this one since Black Ops 1 and 2 were... decent? they deffinately weren't as bad as the other collosol pieces of ♥♥♥♥ like Ghosts and Advanced Warware, so yeah I had hopes.

After seeing the trailer I had come to realise this game 'borrowed' alot of ideas from different games/films like Deus Ex, The Matrix, even Destiny.. that's fine, games do that all the time but after playing the story (eventually after huge performance problems) I realised not only did this game take it's inspiration from different franchises it directly took a massive ♥♥♥♥ on them, what is this? seriously WHAT IS THIS? IT'S A JUMBLED UP ♥♥♥♥ING MESS, imagine an extremely small room packed with 10 computers, loads of sockets all of them full, wires everywhere, you can't even move for wires, that's this game, a jumbled, overhyped, poorly written, poorly made piece of ♥♥♥♥.

From what I could tell the zombies part of the game is the only.. decent part of this game though again, oooh treyarch you're so edge, go ♥♥♥♥ yourselves my friends, please annihilate this franchise, it's disgusting.

reviewText: I want to recommend this game i really do. It seems to have a fun feel to it. Unfortunately i feel as if treyarch really doesn't care for the PC gamer. A finished product that released a beta should have no issues but here we are 3 days after its release and there are still tons of problems. Everyone has a different problem and so far no useful patches. WHAT MAKES THIS GAME UNPLAYABLE FOR ME **FLICKERING SHADOWS** I feel like i'm going to have a seizure if i keep playing this game. Every movement depicts a different shadow causing every texture in the game to be a strobe light of black shadows any way i move. HOW CAN I POSSIBLY SEE ANY OTHER MOVEMENT? its awful. Also the game loves to crash when you exit it. Leaving you in limbo for however long it takes. I just reboot my computer after 15 minutes. Shame because i was expecting more.. Treyarch is too focused on those nerds from consoles that they don't give a flying sh*t about our problems on PC just another 60 bucks a pop for them hopefully they fix these issues and i will have better things to say about them. Wait until this game updates to buy. Also for those who think these issues are graphics related that simply isn't so. I run well above the recommended reqs

reviewText:
Allright, here we go.
First off al, I want to start off with the fact that I swore on my whole family that I would never ever touch cod again when they added that Double Jump ♥♥♥♥. But ye, here we are :p.
Keep in mind that I've never played a COD Game on PC Before!

Personally, I've been really enjoying the game. It's very competive but also (for me atleast, could just be me being bad) quite hard on PC. Lvling up goes quite fast and It's not that hard to earn camo's.
In the beginning although getting used to that double jumping and sliding can really be a pain in the ♥♥♥ but once you get the hang of it it gets less annoying.

Pro's:
-Pretty competitive on PC.
-Fast games, not like CS:GO Competives.
-Alot of variation in maps and gamemodes.
-Not many cheaters. (yet)
-Decent graphics.
-Feels good when having a killstreak or blasts some kids away with the new specials.

Con's:
-Pretty toxic community, if you want to take the game serious you gotta have to deal with arguing players or little kids from time to time. But you can always mute them.
-Pretty hard to learn the maps, specialists and controlls in the beginning.
-Expensive. I'd suggest ♥♥♥ Or ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.
-Other players will sometimes ♥♥♥♥ on you because they have better weapons.
-Matchmaking can be pretty bad at times.
-Laggy servers from time to time.
-Can be hard to run for some people, I've read articles about people having a good pc and getting ♥♥♥♥♥♥ frames. Do some research before buying it!

Conclusion:
I've been really enjoying BO3 so far which I didn't expect at all. I'm going to give it a 7/10. If you can manage to pick it up for 30 euros on ♥♥♥/♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ I do recommend it.

Thanks for Reading,
-Tigah

reviewText:
Easily the best Call of Duty game yet, and it will stay that way for a long time. That sounds corny, I know, but it actually is. I've played every CoD game since MW3, every single one has disappointed me, until I got this. If you are looking at getting any Call of Duty game, this is the one to get.

Pros
-The campaign's story: It is surreal, it is visceral, it is disturbing, it is philosophical, it is easily one of the best I have ever played, and the game is worth buying for the story alone. There are scenes in this game that are going to stick with me for years to come. I have no idea how Treyarch will top this.
-Campaign enemies: Lots of new enemies in this, including combat robots and walking tanks, all are actually unique in the way they act
-Overall amount of content: You get a full co-op/solo campaign mode, a version of MW3's Survival mode in Campaign, a freerunning mode, classic zombie survival, a zombies campaign, something like Forza's livery editor, and, of course, multiplayer.
-The weapons: A lot of the weapons feel very nice to shoot - personal favorites are the Man O' War, Gorgon and the Vesper
-Freerunning: 3arc designed the freerunning mechanics around curves instead of straight lines like Advanced Warfare, and it feels great. Things just flow so nicely, and it's not blatantly unbalanced like Advanced Warfare, either. Also, you have complete control over your gun while freerunning, and it's so, so satisfying when you can rack up a killstreak going from wallrunning to powersliding to hovering to wallrunning.
-The atmosphere of the campaign: It never feels as if you are fighting against some random terrorist group like it does in the other games, in fact, I forgot who the main groups in the game were because the hunt for Taylor and his group of 3 squadmates was all I could focus on. It feels personal, almost.
-Multiplayer specialists: Each one is focused towards a specific style of play. Choose Sparrow if you like sniping, choose Spectre for CQB and stealth and Reaper for more of an assault character.
-Gunsmith: This is a lot like Forza's livery creator. Take any weapon and create a paintjob for it using a large assortment of decals. You can also create variants of guns by mixing and matching attachments, these variants can be used in any mode you choose.
-Mods: This is the first Call of Duty game to have mod support since World at War. Official mod tools, along with dedicated server browsers are expected sometime in mid-2016. Go figure.
-It's addicting: I can't put my finger on it, but something about this game is really addicting.
-Graphics: A lot of pieces of this game look incredibly good, definitely one of the better-looking games that I own. Faces were one of the things that really stood out to me.

Controversial
-Weapon balance: People say that this game has good weapon balance. Maybe I'm just ♥♥♥♥ at the game, but I feel like most of the weapons are balanced and then there's 3 that are just incredibly OP. See: Vesper, Drakon, and HVK30
-Zombies: A lot of people say that Zombies was not very well done, but for what it's worth I think it's ok. They've treated it like an actual mode now, you have ranks and as I've mentioned, you can customize your weapons you get from the wall and mystery box.
-Campaign superpowers": This was supposed to be one of the big features of the campaign
date: but I never felt the need to actually use them at all. This is probably just dependent on how you play though.\n-Campaign characters: A few are very memorable
recommended: like Sarah Hall and John Taylor
hoursPlayed: but some of the others are just bland and forgettable\n-The community: I feel like the community has improved a bit

reviewText:
Black Ops III is packed with content, the zombies and multiplayer experiences are awesome, I haven't played the campaign, but I never do. For me I enjoy the COD multiplayer experience, Blops III really delivers. A great range of guns, score streaks, perks and equipment to play around with.

The maps, oh my, the maps! Blops III has in my opinion the second best multiplayer maps in COD history, WAW taking the #1 spot.
I wasn't a fan of the jet packing and futuristic wall running at first but it has grown on me and now I really enjoy it.

A lot of people are moaning about the servers as usual, the game runs perfectly for me.
I love the black market, where you can use game tokens earned by playing or pay real money to earn more tokens quickly, then use these tokens to try your luck at a kind of slot machine, unlocking rare and exclusive camos, weapons etc But it's not pay to win, it's basically all cosmetic.

I do not like: The specialist abilities. Why is it OK for someone that is 4/17 to destroy me with a had held noob tube or a flame thrower with ease?
Answer: It's not. Any boosts or specialist abilities should be earned, not just by being in the game for an amount of time.
That hand held greanade launcher is insane and ridiculous.

My final word.

reviewText:
This is the best Call of Duty since MW2. I've spent the last 6 years making fun of CoD players. You either die a tool, or you live long enough to accept the Dew and Doritos into your heart.

I have experienced 0 crashes in dozens of hours. Occasional framerate drops, but nothing gamebreaking - maybe giving up a kill every now and then. Effects are great, screen clutter is great without performance hits, and Specialist and weapon balancing is on point. There is no dominant loadout or gun, as pistols can hold their own against semi-auto snipers.

I absolutely recommend this game if you aren't psychotic about tick-rates, wall-banging, or serious competitive environments and just want a fast-paced arcadey FPS.

Addendum: I've noticed the vast majority of the review for this game are negative because of people experiencing frame rate issues. These people then proceed to post their beastly" computer builds

reviewText:
Treyarch delivered, once again.
After 2 bad years for the franchise we finally get a good and playable game.

There is support for the PC community and bugs are patched regularly (unfortunately this wasnt granted in the last 2 years).

I cant say anything about the campaign because i simply dont play it. I never did and i doubt i ever will.

The Multiplayer is good. Not very good but good. The movements are far away from Advanced Warfare and you can still dominate a game if you dont use them. The maps are colorful and mainly have a good flow (3 way system).
The weapons are balanced imho. At least there is no obvious overpowered gun.

One new addition to this game is the blackmarket. Its nearly the same as the supply frops in AW but till now they dont offer weapon variants. There are camos, melee weapons (reskined), gestures and attachment variants (just cosmetic).

To open supply drops you have to use crypto keys, which u get by playing the game. You can also buy COD points to open the supply drops. I dont like the route activision takes but as long as people spend their money in micro transactions, we wont get rid off this.

The best thing about this game is Zombies. Either if you play solo or with your friends - it is awesome.
They added some new features without taking the good old zombies feeling. Gobblegums are produced by Liquid Divinium which you either get by playing or spending COD points. These gums can save your ♥♥♥ in some tough situations without being OP.

If you enjoyed playing COD before, you will enjoy this game even more.
If you didnt play COD till now, this game is good to get in touch with the franchise.

Campaign: unrated
Multiplayer: 8/10
Zombies: 10/10

reviewText:
I've been ignoring COD releases for a few years now but decided to give Call of Duty: Black Ops III a chance when I saw it on a good deal over on Greenman Gaming.  The first Black Ops game in my opinion stands out above the rest.  So how does the new one hold up?  It's alright.

Some new features such as more mobility (jump-packs, sliding, wall-running), characters to choose each with a special weapon and ability, some interesting weapons, and your basic melee attack doesn't one-hit kill unless from behind (however you can equip a knife in your secondary slot that will one-hit kill).  Overall a decent experience.  It still suffers from some of the same issues as usual, and perhaps new ones as well, but it's not a bad game.  It's not ground-breaking innovation either though, this is COD we're talking about.  They play it safe.  So if you're expecting innovation then save your money.

There were some launch issues with the game I believe, but those as far as I can tell have all been fixed.  The game runs wonderfully for me at max settings with 60 fps.  I have never encountered any server issues either.

I can't speak for the singleplayer experience or zombies as I have yet to try either.  If I ever do, I will update this review as needed.

reviewText:
Competitive game with an awful performance isn't a good idea. Days trying to boost FPS, no success. Even after game patches and driver updates, everyone still complaining about game performance, for a good reason. Go play Black Ops 2 and be happy.

Black Ops 2:
- Extra settings, 200~300 fps, very good graphics

Black Ops 3:
- Low/off settings, 1/3 of BO2 fps, fps drop, stuttering due the fluctuation of GPU usage, shiitty graphics. Also, from Extra to Low make a gain of only 20~30 fps. The only way to gain a real amount of FPS is changing the rendering resolution to 50~80% of native resolution, making the graphics even worst and completely unplayable.

Other things to mention (BO3):
- Sometimes to play online you must keep trying many times, because sometimes it gives an error code for no reason.
- When I downloaded the game, it didn't come with my native language and was giving error to launch the game. I downloaded a language pack on internet and now works, but it isn't updated and some texts are just labels like MENU_MISSION_STARTING". Months after still not fixed and Activision don't give a shiit.

My rig:
- gtx 980 sc
- i7 4790k
- 12gb ram"

reviewText:
Recomendar Call of Duty em pleno 2015? Ainda é Possivel!
A Campanha, é Ok, só Ok, veja bem, não há outra possivel definição. Houve a introdução de elementos como o QG onde você verá seus colecionáveis, customizará a armadura e as armas, mas não falo de Loadout e sim de pintura e desenhos em si, faça o que quiser, o problema é que isso tudo é apenas: Inutil! (Ao Menos na Campanha)

O Zombies! Ai sim, fomos surpreendidos!
É o melhor, se em BO2 já existia um modo bem divertido e que valia para passar o tempo, em BO3 isso tudo foi maximizado e é como se todos os aspectos negativos daquele zombies tivessem sido resolvidos, os mapas são ainda maiores e talvez(só talvez) deixaram ainda mais dificil toda a experiencia, isso sem citar a maior variedade de Inimigos e Perks, além da narrativa que finalmente convence. Simplesmente Sensácional, por si valeria o título.

E o Multiplayer? BO2 com DASHS, é exatamente como se eu estivesse jogando há dois anos porém com gráficos muito bonitos e toda a mecãnica de saltos.

-Agora há a customização completa da arma, assim como havia a dos emblemas; o Mercado Negro onde é possivel trocar Points ganhos EM JOGO por pacotes contendo itens desbloqueaveis apenas pelos mesmos e a enorme variedade de Especialistas, cada um com habilidades unicas e que merecem o seu teste até que se decida qual realmente será sua classe, além da excelente customização da armadura de cada um conforme se avança nos objetivos.

-Há também alguns modos secundários que envolvem a aprendizagem e aperfeiçoamento das técnicas de DASH"

reviewText:
NOTE: THIS IS JUST AN OPINION, NOT FACTS.

8/10 - Campaign is fun but is far from Call of Duty mastery, the multiplayer mode is one of the best ones I've seen in any Call of Duty, and the Zombies is just as fun, with new features such as the new pack a punch system and the gobblegum machines to spice things up.

Campaign is fun, but the plot isn't great. The gameplay is just as good as other Call of Duties, but sometimes the plot can be confusing and by the end of the Campaign you won't be paying any attention to the plot. If you're looking for a CoD with a great campaign try CoD Advanced Warfare, CoD4 Modern Warfare, CoD Black Ops, or CoD Black Ops 2.

There's a Nightmares mode waiting after the Campaign, it's essentially a Zombies campaign. It's fun, the plot is great, but it's not the Zombies campaign that follows the original Zombies universe that we've always wanted.

Multiplayer is amazing. The movement system cannot be compared to the movement system of any other CoD. It's not chaotic like Advanced Warfare, and feels just right. The guns are very balanced, although some are quite annoying when used well (Drakon for example, great for certain situations, and when someone with good aim is using it, it can be devastating and very annoying). The maps are very fun and the killstreaks are fun and balanced.  I would also like to mention the supply drops in this game only give cosmetic items, unlike Advanced Warfare where you can get powerful weapons.

EDIT: You can now get weapons inside Supply Drops, but I've used each one and none of them are overpowered; they are really fun to use but not viable for competitive play. The only one that is close to being viable in competitive play is the MX Garand which currently (excluding snipers which have NO downsides) has the least downsides when attaching a suppressor.

Zombies is just as fun as the other games. The Shadows of Evil map in this game can be very unforgiving to new players compared to other games, as in order to survive past round 15 you will need to know the map well and it's easter eggs. The Giant is an amazing remake, familiar but a little bit different, bringing in new surprises. There's a new second pack a punch system, so when you pack a punch a weapon for the second time, instead of getting a boring attachment, you get a gun upgrade. Sometimes your gun may set zombies on fire, sometimes it may turn some of the zombies you shoot into powerful allies, sometimes it may occasionally spawn a fireworks turret, or it may make your gun shoot electric that chains on to multiple zombies. The Gobblegum system is great, and even though you can pay to buy Gobblegum packs, you will still need to be skillful at the game to survive, and there's a one-gobblegum-per-round restriction.

reviewText:
AMD Crosshair V Formula Z
AMD FX-8370 overclocked  to 4.8
Nvidia GTX 980 FTW edition with stock FTW speeds
WD Black 2 TB Drive
Windows 10 64 bit (Optimized for high performance)
32 Gb ddr3 1866
Absolute newest Nvidia driver 358.91

This is strictly a performance review. I run at 1080P with every single possible option at ultra/all way up and anti aliasing all the way up. Called cinematic smting or other. No need to turn the rendering scale down either. Anyway it screams, and i can play it with every frame synced or say screw it and let the 980 loose to over 130 fps easily. I did notice a couple slight and very quick (lasted milliseconds) fps drops during campaign but nothing that caused lag bc already running very fast. Multilayer smooth as can be.  But i will say that I was surprised how CPU bound it is, and per Treyarch, the more cores you throw at it, it will use them. I have never had a game go past 42 ish on my cpu. Pushing this im at round 50. No big deal but worth mentioning.

Bottom line:Just got the game and like COD games, so I like the game so far.  Runs like a champ, but like other reviewers have said, you cant have a poop pc and expect to run 2015/soon to be 2016 games. Then again, most people consider AMD cpus weak and i run this thing like butter. If you like Call of Duty then you'll like this game.

Lastly, I have never written a Steam review but felt I had to because of all the bad performance reviews so far. And I was ready to write a bad review if it didn't perform well. Also as you notice I have AMD and Nvidia(intel) products and like both companies. But I must say it is absolutely hilarious when I see people with i7 complaining that they can't run this game. And I want an i7 too... or the new Zen. Lol

reviewText:
Okay, so I've played this game for a while, and it's great. But the thing is, how can it be a great game if you see screen tearing every 30 seconds? It is close to unplayable. I have an i7 4770k and a GTX 980 but I still get about 20-30 fps. It is horribly optimized for PC at the moment and do not buy it right now. Additionally, you will always be matched up with players of much higher skill (Max Level, Prestiege 3, etc.) and they always play against you. No matter what, you will always somehow get outgunned for some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t reason. Not only that, the community is comparable to toxcicity of CS:GO. Lastly, I wanted to put in that players that use cheap or OP weapons are bountiful. I saw someone get a nuclear with the automatic shotgun, the Haymaker-12. What do you get if you put all this together? You get a cheap scam as a PC port from consoles. A lot of these points are on console as well, so watch out for that. In conclusion, do not buy this game at the moment. Wait for Treyarch to hopefully fix these issues, nerf weapons that need nerfing, buff weapons that need buffing, improve the stability, and make this game a worthy successor to Black Ops 2.

reviewText: Call of Duty Black Ops III makes much of the trailer true. The multiplayer specialists add something extra customizable, and the rise of the gunsmith and paintjobs bring in something for the artistic soldier. The emblem creator is better than ever, with double the layer capacity and no need to unlock any of the ''premium'' emblems. Zombies is an entirely new mode in Black Ops III, with its own leveling, customizable weapons, new perks, new weapons, new zombies, new bosses, new easter eggs, and a freaking gumball machine. Campaign adds a new difficulty: Realistic. This is a difficulty only the best will manage to beat: one shot is enough to kill you, and the enemies behave a lot smarter.\n\nFor a grade, i would give Black Ops III a 8 out of 10 points. It's new, revolutionary, while still keeping the amazing features from its predecessors. A must have for every dedicated shooter-fan out there.

Lastly, I wanted to put in that players that use cheap or OP weapons are bountiful. I saw someone get a nuclear with the automatic shotgun, the Haymaker-12. What do you get if you put all this together? You get a cheap scam as a PC port from consoles. A lot of these points are on console as well, so watch out for that. In conclusion, do not buy this game at the moment. Wait for Treyarch to hopefully fix these issues, nerf weapons that need nerfing, buff weapons that need buffing, improve the stability, and make this game a worthy successor to Black Ops 2.

reviewText:
I really want to like this game.

I enjoyed what I was able to play of it, which was mostly the campaign.

I regret not being able to finish it, especially after paying so much for the game.

The default settings were harsh, and I crashed (computer froze complete), but I went online and look for community fixes for the game, and did all I could to update drivers, adjust settings, and make this train not go boom.

At first, I felt like I had some success. After using a community guide and following it's fix instructions, the game looked better and did play more stable. I thought I had found the solution and everything was fixed.

The train was rolling again.

Then blue screen.

Then train go boom.

I restart, go back into game.

After a hour or so I blue screen again.

Same result, train go boom.

I am stubborn, so I attempt a few more times because I was enjoying the game, but after a short period the game would still keep crashing to blue screen.

My Black Ops was becoming Blue Ops, both figuratively and literally.

I am now at a mission in both Online and Offline mode, where every time I go to deploy, the game just crashes my PC.

End result, train went boom.

My PC is a I7, Windows 7, 64 bit with 8 gig ram. I use AMD Radeon R9 graphics card.

My computer is normally very stable and runs anything without problems new or old. From Jade Empire to Witcher 3. I am usually good at finding fixes or patches when it is need, but nothing I could do was able to help here. I even tried trouble shooting on my own.

The train still went boom.

I know it is not on my end, so at this time I can not recommend this game because of the above technical issues. The game itself is fun, so if you have one of PC that can get it to run...

It is a huge gamble with this price though.

I hope the developers will fix the game. If so, I would happily give it a positive rating, but as it is, I have only grown tortured and have no retries left in me.

Treyarch, please save this train. :(

reviewText: Call of Duty Black Ops III makes much of the trailer true. The multiplayer specialists add something extra customizable, and the rise of the gunsmith and paintjobs bring in something for the artistic soldier. The emblem creator is better than ever, with double the layer capacity and no need to unlock any of the ''premium'' emblems. Zombies is an entirely new mode in Black Ops III, with its own leveling, customizable weapons, new perks, new weapons, new zombies, new bosses, new easter eggs, and a freaking gumball machine. Campaign adds a new difficulty: Realistic. This is a difficulty only the best will manage to beat: one shot is enough to kill you, and the enemies behave a lot smarter.\n\nFor a grade, i would give Black Ops III a 8 out of 10 points. It's new, revolutionary, while still keeping the amazing features from its predecessors. A must have for every dedicated shooter-fan out there.

reviewText:
In regards to the Call of Duty: Black Ops III - Multiplayer Starter Pack:

The BO3 multiplayer is a good time and I think opening it up to people for the same price as CSGO is a great move by Treyarch! It'll really allow the community to grow and BO3 can thrive on PC compared to other CoDs. (hey, most Treyarch games are still alive on PC, they seem to be best at PC cods for the most part) Some might find it a bummer that you can't prestige, but besides permanent unlock tokens prestige is just to show off progression, and as far as I'm concerned CSGO has no progression system besides of course, trying to rank up in matchmaking, and yet look how big it is. So this honestly shouldn't be a problem since you can still get all of the base weapons, and you have access to the black market for skins and the chance to get some rare weapons.

I guess one of the biggest questions is when mod support comes, will players on this version have access? Mod support has the possibility to make BO3 even better on PC, and if a wider audience has access to the supposed separate lobbies that will have mod support, the possibilites go on. Besides that, I'm guessing the season pass will only be available to owners of the full game. Reasonable enough, since you can still upgrade to the full game, and there's a decent selection of maps to begin with. Mod support could bring in more maps anyhow.

Either way if you want to try out the BO3 multiplayer with a lower entry fee, and ESPECIALLY if you're only interested in the multiplayer aspect (not co-op, competitive multiplayer) the multiplayer starter pack is definitely for you.

reviewText:
This is actually my first time buying and playing a Call of Duty game. I quite enjoyed playing this game, especially Zombies mode.
But in all honesty, I cannot recommend this game. The main reason being that it is so heavily connection based, even for online solo playthroughs in Campaign and Zombies. I know there is the offline modes for them and recently Zombies. but it's not as fun because most if not all the unlockables are already unlocked, you can't play with others besides locally and the fact that none of the offline progression counts towards your online profile. Worst example would be Campaign, say you played about half the chapters, found a good amount of the collectable items and got to level 10, go online, you'll have to do that all over again.

Multiplayers' connection is a bit of a mess right now. When I first started playing multiplayer some matches would have played smoothly, whereas some was a bit laggy, yet still managable. But now, I get about 10/10 laggy matches. Thing is it just makes it so much more frustrating, because you know you can do better than your stats would display at the end or not being able to get that easy kill because the player in front of your is either warping or your shots aren't hitting. I have to resort to playing with the shotgun now to even get any kills in at all because headshots are out of the question when your aim staggers from the lag.

reviewText:
Call od Duty has made a mistake in this game and it's previous; Advanced Warfare.
Generally graphics should improve with each new game... not the case with CoD. CoD Ghosts looks and runs smoother.
Mitmarkers (where a bullet hits the body) are all over the shop. You watch a bullet head towards the target... before it reaches the target you know that it will miss (based on bullet trajectory and target movement) and then suddenly it registers as a hit!! The opposite happens as well! Worst case is you watch a bullet head towards the waistline or leg and it registers as a headshot. Then when you see your bullet head straight to the targets head (and the head is the only thing visible) it registers as a hit (sometimes) but not as a headshot!!
On the upside this game is better than Advanced Warfare and they have the making of a really good game with the exosuits being restricted compared to AW.  Accuracy of bullet hitmarkers, graphics improvements and better weapon balancing" is required for me to give this game a better rating.
The jury is still out if I will purchase another Call of Duty game in the future."

reviewText:
Gonna try to keep this review short and sweet. I've played through the campaign and dabbled a bit in both zombies and MP, but not too much.

The game performs well for me. I haven't had any issues with stuttering, but the frame rate can fluctuate a fair bit and the game can be very heavy on your system. SP played great on medium-high with a 770 but I prefer to turn it down for MP for that sweet (mostly) solid 120 fps. I don't want to discredit the people with real issues but I do see people just being stubborn with turning down settings sometimes and then claiming they have performance issues, so take the angriest reviews with a bit of salt :)

Most of the PC features you want are here and all MP games are on dedi servers. Very happy with the work the PC team has done.

Campaign is your standard mind ♥♥♥♥ Black Ops storyline. Sadly it doesn't tie in very much to the previous games, but there's a fair bunch to think about here, and there are little clues that things aren't perhaps as they seem. I think there might be a deeper meaning of things that you can't figure out right away. I appreciate that in a game. You can tell the campaign is made for coop play, levels are very large and missions long with loads of enemies. Me playing solo at veteran difficulty could spend a good minute just picking enemies off from a distance before entering the fray so I didn't overwhelm myself. It still has the same cinematic setpieces and a gorillion explosions going off so the pure action fans won't be disappointed. The mind powers you get are pretty cool to shake things up but a bit cumbersome to switch between. I ended up mainly using the same active and passive abilites the entire game, but the choice is there if you want it.

I haven't tried the nightmares mode yet. It's played on the same maps as the campaign but with a new story line and zombies, which looks freaking amazing but can't give my own thoughts on it yet. I will say I like the idea as I find zombies cool but I don't like the round based stuff much.

Zombies itself then is neat, but I haven't played much. For a super casual zombies player like me I enjoy just running around the map, buying a few wall guns and dying at level 5 but I'll get the hang of it eventually. There's a lot here if you want to spend some time with it.

MP is fun so far. I have to admit I don't like the specialists much, their abilites are extremely powerful and I prefer just playing gun on gun. Otherwise it is reminiscent of BO2 in many ways (which I loved too) with an extra dimension through new movement techniques. They do a lot to make you move fluently through maps and it's fun to find new tricks. Firefights still stay mainly on the ground and shooting midair is pretty awkward. People equaling the movement to that in AW are absolutely clueless.

The guns are very varied and all of them viable, perks like wise. Pick 10 is as good as ever. Streaks a little weaker than BO2 which I personally like. New game modes are nice, but nothing revolutionary. Good stuff overall and I'll think I'll pop in from time to time a lot over the next few years. Balance is a thing that will evolve over time but so far I'm digging it.

---

It's perhaps not the most ground breaking game ever, but it's the best Call of Duty in a long time and a very entertaining experience in its own right. Treyarch always makes solid titles and you can tell they're proud of the game they've made.

8/10 looking forward to modding this spring

reviewText:
No spoiler in this review.

The latest episode in Call of Duty franchise. Continuing the story from WAW, BO1 and BO2. The time is setting in the future, 2065. All the sci-fi stuff is awesome and fantastic in both appearance and functionality. Generally, the main menu is fabulous. You may admire your own character in the menu backgrounds. And you can locally play with friends in split-screen! (Support both vertical or horizontal split) This is very cool if you want to play together locally.

The game breaks into 3 big modes: Campaign, Multiplayer and Zombies. In BO3, all these modes are quite decent individually. Moreover, all 3 modes are well connected. Such as, in Multiplayer mode, you may use the camo which was previously unlocked in Campaign mode. Most of the unlocks and customizations are shared in all 3 modes. And in each mode you have your own progress. They all have levels, achievements and statistics separately. Besides, all 3 modes have multiplayer which means you can play these modes with friends! Campaign and Zombies mode both support COOP up to 4 players.

Another awesome part is the customizations and the media community. Most of the FPS game (such as Battlefield series) allow players to decorate their guns with camo. And also have custom Emblems for creative players to show themselves. In BO3, each custom Emblem support up to 64 layers. Which means you could create almost anything you want. Furthermore, you may also fully customize your weapons with Camo" and "Paint Job"
date: even "Clan Tag" or "Kill Counter" if you got prestige. These customizations are not only for you to please yourself. You can upload your sick guns the to in-game media community. All the BO3 players could see your works and rate them
recommended: even download them if they like it. So the customization and social functionality is quite robust in BO3. (Screenshots sharing coming soon)\n\nIn order to clearly express my opinion
hoursPlayed:
I will review BO3 mode by mode.

Campaign
Very nice and deep story
voteText: continue the story from BO2. The story is so deep (imo) that you may have to play over and over again to truly understand the true story behind the scenes. reviewText: It started when one day i was watching my kids play this on their PSBOX720, it had me interested so I bought the game thinking it would be a fun thing to do after I got home from work to relieve some stress and relax. Well a week into playing I became addicted. I needed more. I started spending a few dollars here and there on the black market, then it started adding up. I started spending thousands on this game, it was taking over my life. I got a second mortgage on my house to spend on BO3. I lost my home and began playing 24/7 on the McDonalds WiFi down the street. My wife divorced me but somehow I got custody of our 3 children. I needed more, so I did the obvious and sold my kids to the slave trade for a few hundred dollars. The urge to get more will never stop. My life is this game.\n\nBut other than that 10/10 game would recommend.
